subject: WIP: Add mysql/mariadb cluster support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-02 19:02:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql-common/bin/mysql-wsrep-notify', 'elements/mysql-common/os-refresh-config/configure.d/51-init-mysql-cluster', 'elements/boot-stack/bin/reset-db', 'elements/mysql-common/install.d/40-mysql-notify', 'elements/mysql-common/os-config-applier/mnt/state/etc/mysql/conf.d/cluster.cnf', 'elements/boot-stack/os-refresh-config/configure.d/52-init-openstack'], 'message': "WIP: Add mysql/mariadb cluster support

Allows joining multiple nodes into mysql cluster. Init process is
tricky because first node has to be started standalone, then once
cluster is created, then this node should rejoin to the existing
cluster on the next restart. And recognize if cluster was already
created is not trivial - additional wsrep notification script is used
for watching cluster changes.

This is based on Greg's clustering patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83675/

I send this out as POC for now, some minor cleanup would be required.

Change-Id: I8fa2dd18950bf3dff7548270ade8cdb08743610e
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add mysql/mariadb cluster support

Allows joining multiple nodes into mysql cluster. Init process is
tricky because first node has to be started standalone, then once
cluster is created, then this node should rejoin to the existing
cluster on the next restart. And recognize if cluster was already
created is not trivial - additional wsrep notification script is used
for watching cluster changes.

This is based on Greg's clustering patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/83675/

I send this out as POC for now, some minor cleanup would be required.

Change-Id: I8fa2dd18950bf3dff7548270ade8cdb08743610e

commit_message:
Allow baremetal-networks to be passed to devtest

Previously change I6e89dc98 allowed custom baremetal networks to be
configured in testenv.json.
This change allows you to pass in those custom entries as a json
file.

Change-Id: Iad5eb781fa236e71a40245d893f8f0b632b5c370

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-11 10:28:15.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/edp/binary_retrievers/internal_swift.py', 'sahara/swift/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix storing binaries in Swift

 * Swift does not work with Keystone API v3, so we need to always provide
   auth_url for API v2 to Swift.
 * We incorrectly parsed swift URL, which resulted in Sahara trying
   to get binaries from containers with '.sahara' suffix, while the
   suffix should be stripped.

Closes-Bug: #1305210
Change-Id: I76dee756165e089bc408e584f3aa476c45ed6067
"}]
commit_message:
Fix storing binaries in Swift

 * Swift does not work with Keystone API v3, so we need to always provide
   auth_url for API v2 to Swift.
 * We incorrectly parsed swift URL, which resulted in Sahara trying
   to get binaries from containers with '.sahara' suffix, while the
   suffix should be stripped.

Closes-Bug: #1305210
Change-Id: I76dee756165e089bc408e584f3aa476c45ed6067

subject: Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 00:24:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/ironic_states.py'], 'message': "Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Cherry picked from 1b1d6b0cec64311ae62443b8647fd528d3c91f1d

Change-Id: Ic3a502167103e84be041ca1ee06fd17d8140529c
Closes-Bug: #1300288
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Cherry picked from 1b1d6b0cec64311ae62443b8647fd528d3c91f1d

Change-Id: Ic3a502167103e84be041ca1ee06fd17d8140529c
Closes-Bug: #1300288

commit_message:
Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: I297e281d096342440208122439fbdacd63c6ce0a
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-11 08:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'Do not sync power state for new invalidated nodes

sync_power_state periodic task puts node in maintenance mode after max
sync retries. If node created and has unknown power state this
periodic task set maintenance mode too fast (there is not yet IPMI
credentials for example).
This patch prevent sync_power_state for these nodes if validate fail.

Closes-Bug: #1304642
Change-Id: I19798028adce91b107643f5419999389dafdccf3
'}]
commit_message:
Do not sync power state for new invalidated nodes

sync_power_state periodic task puts node in maintenance mode after max
sync retries. If node created and has unknown power state this
periodic task set maintenance mode too fast (there is not yet IPMI
credentials for example).
This patch prevent sync_power_state for these nodes if validate fail.

Closes-Bug: #1304642
Change-Id: I19798028adce91b107643f5419999389dafdccf3

commit_message:
Fix for enormous progress bar rising of deployment task

Weight for node deletion subtask of deployment supertask in
ApplyChangesTaskManager added. New integration tests added. Some
refactoring to TaskHelper performed: formula that calculate progress for
supertask has been moved to separate class method.

Change-Id: I2143f9999320c66b49940844d5b1b7a7f5e2a77c
Closes-Bug: #1286124

commit_message:
Obsolete Murano components removed

The following Murano components are no longer exist as separate objects:
* murano-conductor
* murano-repository
* murano-metadataclient

They were merged into murano-api according to the blueprint:
* https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/repository-reorganization

Closes-bug: 1306547

Change-Id: Ib45de78c00d680cb1cff4ff01c7c79de96e6d4f0

commit_message:
Use logdest syslog for puppet

Newer puppet 3.4.3 has working syslog
for puppet apply. Thus we can send messages
to syslog easily without usage of ImFile puppet
module.

Change-Id: Ibfdd4ab094fcf9586376a7f67369db65adc4006c
Closes-bug: #1304286

subject: Restart eth1 if we can't contact the geard broker
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-08 15:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Restart eth1 if we can't contact the geard broker

Fedora 20 instances sometimes fail to get an IP on the test network
Attempt to work around the problem by restarting the interface.

We have no guarantee that the address range of the test network wont
change at some stage so instead of testing for an IP existing on a
specific range we just test we can ping the geard broker.

I've also moved where we set PATH so that we can find the if* commands.

Change-Id: I57f3beab10021e87f169ca5c6efbd310c54bf730
Related-Bug: #1304085
"}]
commit_message:
Restart eth1 if we can't contact the geard broker

Fedora 20 instances sometimes fail to get an IP on the test network
Attempt to work around the problem by restarting the interface.

We have no guarantee that the address range of the test network wont
change at some stage so instead of testing for an IP existing on a
specific range we just test we can ping the geard broker.

I've also moved where we set PATH so that we can find the if* commands.

Change-Id: I57f3beab10021e87f169ca5c6efbd310c54bf730
Related-Bug: #1304085

commit_message:
Remove unnessary logging conf files from Ironic elements

This patch removes unnessary logging conf files. These files are not
needed and are preventing logging from working correctly. By removing
these files the Ironic services will be better able to manage their
own logging.

Change-Id: I00b101157745387a921bd682266344b55d0558b5

commit_message:
lb-agent: fix get_interfaces_on_bridge returning None

Change get_interfaces_on_bridge() to return [] instead of None
if the bridge is not found, as callers are expecting an iterator.

Change-Id: I359a2a0cf932c049f6891d4ba3eb8b9b23ab360d
Related-Bug: 1284311

commit_message:
Remove unused variable for UpdateReplace exception

Base class Exception have not attribute "_message" and variable
"message" has default value in init method, so attribute "_message"
could be removed.

Change-Id: I304e13d1923ef043f04f03477b94f88cea4bc52f

commit_message:
Remove mock.patch.stop from tests that inherit from BaseTestCase

The tests that inherit from BaseTestCase don't need to stop their
patches, since this is already done in the base class

Change-Id: Ibb1183e521686d6e948046997b32f4044d91d9e7
Closes-bug: #1305656

subject: Stop neutron resource leaking even if an error occurs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-03-27 06:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_extra_dhcp_options.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_floating_ips.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_load_balancer.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_networks.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_vpnaas_extensions.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_ports.py', 'tempest/api/network/admin/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'tempest/api/network/admin/test_lbaas_agent_scheduler.py', 'tempest/api/network/admin/test_load_balancer_admin_actions.py', 'tempest/api/network/test_routers_negative.py'], 'message': 'Stop neutron resource leaking even if an error occurs

In some test, if an error occurs in setUpClass(), some resources
are not deleted because of tearDownClass() is not called.
This commit fixes it.

 tempest/api
  +---- baremetal (unnecessary)
  +---- compute
  +---- data_processing (unnecessary)
  +---- database (unnecessary)
  +---- identity
  +---- image (done)
  +---- network         <-- this patch
  +---- object_storage
  +---- orchestration
  +---- queuing (unnecessary)
  +---- telemetry (unnecessary)
  +---- volume (done)

Partially Implements: blueprint stop-leaking

Change-Id: I580be8f974e3daa8ae4895ebb3e4311be8f9c242
'}]
commit_message:
Stop neutron resource leaking even if an error occurs

In some test, if an error occurs in setUpClass(), some resources
are not deleted because of tearDownClass() is not called.
This commit fixes it.

 tempest/api
  +---- baremetal (unnecessary)
  +---- compute
  +---- data_processing (unnecessary)
  +---- database (unnecessary)
  +---- identity
  +---- image (done)
  +---- network         <-- this patch
  +---- object_storage
  +---- orchestration
  +---- queuing (unnecessary)
  +---- telemetry (unnecessary)
  +---- volume (done)

Partially Implements: blueprint stop-leaking

Change-Id: I580be8f974e3daa8ae4895ebb3e4311be8f9c242

subject: Fixes Glance Registry V2 client
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-11 08:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_db.py', 'glance/db/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/functional/db/test_registry.py', 'glance/db/registry/api.py'], 'message': "Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: Id2c52c423b411ec20bdfa76ee91837c98b1613ef
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes Glance Registry V2 client

Add an optional configuration step to glance.db.get_api().

This step is then used in glance.db.registry.api in order to ensure that
the registry client has been configured in time for the registry db
driver's use.

Closes bug: #1302345

Change-Id: Id2c52c423b411ec20bdfa76ee91837c98b1613ef
Co-Authored-By: Mark J. Washenberger <mark.washenberger@markwash.net>

after updating code in tempest

subject: Add a warning to not use get_table for working with ForeignKeys
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-07 15:54:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': "Add a warning to not use get_table for working with ForeignKeys

The get_table utility loads a single table with a unique MetaData object
each time it's called but sqlalchemy needs the MetaData object to hold
information about both tables in the ForeignKey constraint so it
shouldn't be used when creating those types of constraints.  This patch
adds a warning to the method's docstring against it's usage in that
case.

Closes-Bug: #1303824

Change-Id: I7b038d668f08f166700300fd787a8cf3cab73a17
"}]
commit_message:
Add a warning to not use get_table for working with ForeignKeys

The get_table utility loads a single table with a unique MetaData object
each time it's called but sqlalchemy needs the MetaData object to hold
information about both tables in the ForeignKey constraint so it
shouldn't be used when creating those types of constraints.  This patch
adds a warning to the method's docstring against it's usage in that
case.

Closes-Bug: #1303824

Change-Id: I7b038d668f08f166700300fd787a8cf3cab73a17

Use matcher from yaql_expression module, thus making YAQL expressions
to be automatically detected and parsed during YAML parsing. This

The sample of new Dynamic UI version can be found at

commit_message:
Automatically parse YAQL-expressions during YAML parsing

Use matcher from yaql_expression module, thus making YAQL expressions
to be automatically detected and parsed during YAML parsing. This
allows to throw away several helper functions.

Also drop obsolete 'attributeNames' attribute handling.

The sample of new Dynamic UI version can be found at
http://paste.openstack.org/show/75428/

This commit should be reviewed in pair with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86376/

Change-Id: I08422a4c6a3e0dff4ad704d209cc27621c2a3c76

StringToBytesTest does not work on Python 3 because it uses testscenarios which

commit_message:
Partial fix of test_strutils.py on Python 3

StringToBytesTest does not work on Python 3 because it uses testscenarios which
does not work in nosetests, see the bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/testscenarios/+bug/872887

Because of this bug, the test_strutils.py is not enabled yet for py33 in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: Ie3a7742dfd802f21c6c7420e3b894122e1dca295

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-11 07:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap/sync/etc/mcollective/server.cfg'], 'message': 'RabbitMQ 3 support

RabbitMQ 3 do not support such big TTL which we used before.
Big TTL was need to solve problem with node time dissynchronization.
Now we use NTP to resolve this issue. That is why this value
can be reduced.

Related-Bug: #1278336
Related-Bug: #1276770
Change-Id: I0a56b88247d9839bc3282294cdb8592ed2701c3a
'}]
commit_message:
RabbitMQ 3 support

RabbitMQ 3 do not support such big TTL which we used before.
Big TTL was need to solve problem with node time dissynchronization.
Now we use NTP to resolve this issue. That is why this value
can be reduced.

Related-Bug: #1278336
Related-Bug: #1276770
Change-Id: I0a56b88247d9839bc3282294cdb8592ed2701c3a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-11 08:59:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/compute_filter.py'], 'message': "Add warn Log in ComputeFilter if a service is disabld by hypervisor

Right now if the ComputeFilter encounters a disabled host,
it just logs it at debug level and skips it. If the host was automatically
disabled because of a connection fail, we should at least log that
as a warning in the scheduler
(like we do now for hosts that haven't checked in for a while)

Change-Id: I9748c2f95148e58072f6a2da3949f3520ce6095e
Partial-Bug: #1258625
"}]
commit_message:
Add warn Log in ComputeFilter if a service is disabld by hypervisor

Right now if the ComputeFilter encounters a disabled host,
it just logs it at debug level and skips it. If the host was automatically
disabled because of a connection fail, we should at least log that
as a warning in the scheduler
(like we do now for hosts that haven't checked in for a while)

Change-Id: I9748c2f95148e58072f6a2da3949f3520ce6095e
Partial-Bug: #1258625

commit_message:
Sync latest oslo.db code

Common db code was updated in oslo. The most important thing is that
engine instances don't stored anymore in oslo.db - ce69e7f.
This patch moves methods `get_engine` and `get_session` to module
`heat.db.sqalchemy.api`.

Latest commit in oslo related to db module:
2fd457bf2ccbeb2b84ffb204778b6417cd5405ba

Change-Id: Iaa2e9ba26e824c678c698914170e3dffbf1c5c95

commit_message:
Use instance data instead of flavor in simple_tenant_usage extension

The simple_tenant_usage extension gets the flavor data from the instance
and then looks up the flavor from the database to return usage information.
Since we now store all of the flavor data in the instance itself,
we should use that information instead of what the flavor currently
says is right. This both (a) makes it more accurate and (b)
avoids us failing to return usage info if a flavor disappears.

Change-Id: I1472d78e8e920013a1db5c76e04715fa04b696c2
Closes-Bug: #1276731

subject: Issue the volume detach request only once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 14:55:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/volume.py', 'heat/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Issue the volume detach request only once

Repeated calls for nova to detach a volume from a server can create a
race condition and leave the volume in wrong state (see bug 1238093).
This patch makes the volume detach call to nova only once to prevent
such problems.

Change-Id: If6f7403122486b9e0fd3d034102e2a6c31b7eee4
Related-Bug: #1298350
'}]
commit_message:
Issue the volume detach request only once

Repeated calls for nova to detach a volume from a server can create a
race condition and leave the volume in wrong state (see bug 1238093).
This patch makes the volume detach call to nova only once to prevent
such problems.

Change-Id: If6f7403122486b9e0fd3d034102e2a6c31b7eee4
Related-Bug: #1298350

commit_message:
Add virtio-scsi bus support for bdm

Add support to use virtio-scsi controller when booting from a cinder
volume which is created from a glance image set with "virito-scsi"
hw_scsi_model property.

blueprint add-virtio-scsi-bus-for-bdm

commit_message:
Add exception handling in "nova diagnostics"

when using "nova diagnostics" with a not running
instance, user will get an incorrect message. This
change handles that exception.

Change-Id: Ia2aa76a5c2c2aeed446411700d74d547dd73cf90
Closes-bug: #1289079

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 11:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/server/producer.rb'], 'message': "Support RabbitMQ 3

For some strange reason EventMachine main thread process
publication message to 'Nailgun' exchange with terrible
delay. Update to new amqp gem (1.3.0) do not solve the
problem. It occurs only in the case of RabbitMQ 3.

Change-Id: I2fc1109bf19313784a72ceabde7da08d3397d2fc
"}]
commit_message:
Support RabbitMQ 3

For some strange reason EventMachine main thread process
publication message to 'Nailgun' exchange with terrible
delay. Update to new amqp gem (1.3.0) do not solve the
problem. It occurs only in the case of RabbitMQ 3.

Change-Id: I2fc1109bf19313784a72ceabde7da08d3397d2fc

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 05:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/services.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/244_add_auto_disabled_in_service.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/objects/service.py'], 'message': 'Add auto_disabled column into service table

Bug 1250049 reported a problem with automatically disabling/enabling
a host via the libvirt driver, but rather than fix it the right way,
Add a new column to the Service table which indicates if an admin
intentionally disabled the host or if nova detected a fail and did
it automatically, a hack was done instead to prefix the 'disabled_reason'
with "AUTO:" and build some logic in the driver around that.

Partial-Bug: #1258625

Change-Id: I8e593136133228f5f48794f5c8f2039dfd1a53a0
'}]
commit_message:
Add auto_disabled column into service table

Bug 1250049 reported a problem with automatically disabling/enabling
a host via the libvirt driver, but rather than fix it the right way,
Add a new column to the Service table which indicates if an admin
intentionally disabled the host or if nova detected a fail and did
it automatically, a hack was done instead to prefix the 'disabled_reason'
with "AUTO:" and build some logic in the driver around that.

Partial-Bug: #1258625

Change-Id: I8e593136133228f5f48794f5c8f2039dfd1a53a0

only remove network states from Nova when n-net is enabled

necessary to remove the states directory of nova-network.

commit_message:
Add Neutron Metering Agent support

In Havana, Neutron has now a Metering Agent which gets meters from
virtual routers.

This patchs aims to allow devstack using this new service.

Change-Id: I17ad83799d60384247b98cc8a93ac032f641c721
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5174, 'name': 'Mauro Rodrigues', 'email': 'maurosr@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'maurosr'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-26 19:18:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/clients.py'], 'message': 'Cinder client does not honor disable_ssl_certificate_validation

The Client() class should pass in insecure as the value of
CONF.identity.disable_ssl_certificate_validation, otherwise many
tests will fail if the cinder server is secured with SSL.

Change-Id: I9bb6ff48a0d53b5b124e58c9959c9a43da8c7e5c
Closes-Bug: 1298019
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder client does not honor disable_ssl_certificate_validation

The Client() class should pass in insecure as the value of
CONF.identity.disable_ssl_certificate_validation, otherwise many
tests will fail if the cinder server is secured with SSL.

Change-Id: I9bb6ff48a0d53b5b124e58c9959c9a43da8c7e5c
Closes-Bug: 1298019

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-07 00:04:27.000000000', 'files': ['reference/programs.yaml'], 'message': "Add mission statement to Cinder

At the TC meeting on 2014-03-25 we did a gap
analysis on the Cinder project and identified that
Cinder still doesn't have an official mission statement.

This change adds the Cinder mission statement and matches
that which is included on the Cinder Wiki page.

Change-Id: I38753f778663bbd22418581ab752efc6f90da29d
"}]
commit_message:
Add mission statement to Cinder

At the TC meeting on 2014-03-25 we did a gap
analysis on the Cinder project and identified that
Cinder still doesn't have an official mission statement.

This change adds the Cinder mission statement and matches
that which is included on the Cinder Wiki page.

Change-Id: I38753f778663bbd22418581ab752efc6f90da29d

commit_message:
Make tests use Node object instead of dict

A number of tests were passing dicts to methods instead of the Node
object. This fixes the tests and some various places in code were doing
node.get() instead of just accessing the Node object attribute directly.

Change-Id: I6d39c861fe771714bdac3b85cbb798f27850565d

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-08 10:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/test_driver_factory.py', 'ironic/tests/api/v1/test_ports.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/common/driver_factory.py', 'ironic/drivers/fake.py', 'ironic/drivers/pxe.py'], 'message': 'Add a whitelist mechanism for drivers

Before Ironic would try to load all the drivers by default, but some
drivers might require libraries that are not part of the requirements.txt
(e.g third-party libraries) and these libraries may also not be present on
the system when the ironic-conductor starts causing things to fail. So
this patch adds a drivers_whitelist option that prevent the drivers
that are not listed to not load. Drivers that depends on external libraries
in trunk should not be listed there by default.

Each driver name in the list is interpreted by Ironic as a pattern that
could contain shell-style wildcards, for e.g: One that wants to enable
all fake drivers could add "fake*" to the list.

Closes-Bug: #1302562
Change-Id: I1749854f91273dbb606adce1de66b886019abe8b
'}]
commit_message:
Add a whitelist mechanism for drivers

Before Ironic would try to load all the drivers by default, but some
drivers might require libraries that are not part of the requirements.txt
(e.g third-party libraries) and these libraries may also not be present on
the system when the ironic-conductor starts causing things to fail. So
this patch adds a drivers_whitelist option that prevent the drivers
that are not listed to not load. Drivers that depends on external libraries
in trunk should not be listed there by default.

Each driver name in the list is interpreted by Ironic as a pattern that
could contain shell-style wildcards, for e.g: One that wants to enable
all fake drivers could add "fake*" to the list.

Closes-Bug: #1302562
Change-Id: I1749854f91273dbb606adce1de66b886019abe8b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-10 18:22:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup running conductor services in tests

The conductor manager tests are not stopping services that are
started, instead relying strickly on database cleanup.  This is
causing condcutor periodic tasks to bleed into other test cases
and cause occasional unrelated deadlocks in logging later on during
test runs.

Change-Id: I7502df5dec7c42fe1a20bebad8f9ad393572d17d
Closes-bug: #1300420
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup running conductor services in tests

The conductor manager tests are not stopping services that are
started, instead relying strickly on database cleanup.  This is
causing condcutor periodic tasks to bleed into other test cases
and cause occasional unrelated deadlocks in logging later on during
test runs.

Change-Id: I7502df5dec7c42fe1a20bebad8f9ad393572d17d
Closes-bug: #1300420

commit_message:
Revise register_cli_opts implemention mistake

In register_cli_opts method, the code
for opt in opts:
     self.register_cli_opts(opt, group)
should be:
for opt in opts:
     self.register_cli_opt(opt, group)

Change-Id: Idc2895806879c36b545c4ab7afaf6a964673cde7

commit_message:
Fuelclient major refactoring

 * package structure
 * some implementation ideas
 * a lot of working functions
 * fixed Fuelclient tests
 * fixed action validation
 * fixed formatting and pep8
 * fixed copyright
 * fixed unnecessary request during deployment

 Implements: blueprint fuelclient-refactoring

Change-Id: Ice7f96273afb5d96e7970acfc45c61bab620aaed

commit_message:
Quick fix for cluster deletion timeout test

commit_message:
attach/detach interface should raise exception when instance is locked

when instance is locked, exception should be raised if attach and
detach an interface operation is performed. This patch add instance
lock check for the 2 APIs, catch and process the exception at API layer.

Change-Id: I6c0b05dafb9d480c8f0002bcc8306cb65a32aaf7
Closes-Bug: #1275741

commit_message:
Add ability to run nailgun tests in parallel on ci

TEST_NAILGUN_DB=nailgun_gw0 nosetests nailgun/test

nosetests uses entry_points, so it requires to run command:

python setup.py develop

Change-Id: Ie5a24d970f73ef35b1c4e61bbc4b2a738d96b34f
Closes-Bug: #1282565

We probably need to use format_message when converting a
NovaException to a string.
As well we can remove the cast to unicode of the parameter msg
from the local method notify since this method will only get
message in a string format.

Change-Id: I6fddfb9e124b4096f0ebc3da81c3044b1b24cedf
'}]
commit_message:
compute: using format_message() to convert exception to string

We probably need to use format_message when converting a
NovaException to a string.
As well we can remove the cast to unicode of the parameter msg
from the local method notify since this method will only get
message in a string format.

Change-Id: I6fddfb9e124b4096f0ebc3da81c3044b1b24cedf

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6802, 'name': 'Joel Coffman', 'email': 'jmc7tp@gmail.com', 'username': 'joel-coffman'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-09 16:44:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Partial-bug: #1221190
Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

Partial-bug: #1221190
Change-Id: Ia1b073f38e096989f34d1774a12a1b4151773fc7

commit_message:
RabbitMQ 3 support

RabbitMQ 3 do not support such big TTL which we used before.
Big TTL was need to solve problem with node time dissynchronization.
Now we use NTP to resolve this issue. That is why this value
can be reduced.

Related-Bug: #1278336
Related-Bug: #1276770
Change-Id: Iee79f14929e9f1ac5e5e7dd07aee37f641d3b2a8

subject: Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 12:54:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.

In order to avoid confusion when calling CrudManager._put()
method a CrudManager._update() method is now used in order to
make a clear statement that there is no different use between
the two methods.
In case url argument in _put() is None, CrudManager.build_url()
will be called.

Change-Id: Idfe384686729ad9be005abf57ddfce2caec81575
'}]
commit_message:
Make base.CrudManager._put() use _update() method.

In order to avoid confusion when calling CrudManager._put()
method a CrudManager._update() method is now used in order to
make a clear statement that there is no different use between
the two methods.
In case url argument in _put() is None, CrudManager.build_url()
will be called.

Change-Id: Idfe384686729ad9be005abf57ddfce2caec81575

subject: Fix listing of stacks with non-ascii parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-25 10:54:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_parameters.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/engine/parameters.py'], 'message': 'Fix listing of stacks with non-ascii parameters

If you create a stack passing a non-ascii string as a value of one
of the parameters, all subsequent stack-list/stack-show calls will
fail with UnicodeDecodeError. All string parameters should be
treated like unicode strings within heat-api/heat-engine processes
and converted from/to bytes only when passed via network.

Related-Bug: #1249234

Change-Id: I0f0f9008401b3a6ebdb2c41905a9a578dfb1aae8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix listing of stacks with non-ascii parameters

If you create a stack passing a non-ascii string as a value of one
of the parameters, all subsequent stack-list/stack-show calls will
fail with UnicodeDecodeError. All string parameters should be
treated like unicode strings within heat-api/heat-engine processes
and converted from/to bytes only when passed via network.

Related-Bug: #1249234

Change-Id: I0f0f9008401b3a6ebdb2c41905a9a578dfb1aae8

subject: add notification alarm
revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-03-03 21:18:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_notification.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/evaluator/test_notification.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/service.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/notification.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_alarm_scenarios.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/threshold.py', 'ceilometer/notification.py', 'ceilometer/tests/alarm/test_notification_alarm_mgr.py'], 'message': 'add notification alarm

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using an API like this:

POST /v2/alarms
{
  "alarm_actions" : [ ],
  "description" : "whatever desc.*",
  "enabled" : true,
  "name" : "site-alarm",
  "ok_actions" : [ ],
  "project_id" : "196d33a3d0e24752b86a66e6948c9c84",
  "repeat_actions" : false,
  "notification_rule" : {
    "notification_type" : "site.*",
    "query" : [
      {
        "field" : "network.name", "type" : "",
        "value" : "examle", "op" : "eq"
      },
      {
        "field" : "age", "type" : "",
        "value" : "5", "op" : "lt"
      }
    ],
    "comparison_operator" : "eq",
    "period" : 1000
  },
  "state" : "insufficient data",
  "type" : "notification",
  "user_id" : "4a1beba01f6c4b10a2b0664f966435be"
}

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
site.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered. The period parameter indicates that the alarm state
will be set back to OK when time elapsed 1000 seconds or more
since the trigger time.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: alarm-on-notification
'}]
commit_message:
add notification alarm

allow alarms to be created based on a notification type or a
payload of a notification. For example: you can create an
alarm using an API like this:

POST /v2/alarms
{
  "alarm_actions" : [ ],
  "description" : "whatever desc.*",
  "enabled" : true,
  "name" : "site-alarm",
  "ok_actions" : [ ],
  "project_id" : "196d33a3d0e24752b86a66e6948c9c84",
  "repeat_actions" : false,
  "notification_rule" : {
    "notification_type" : "site.*",
    "query" : [
      {
        "field" : "network.name", "type" : "",
        "value" : "examle", "op" : "eq"
      },
      {
        "field" : "age", "type" : "",
        "value" : "5", "op" : "lt"
      }
    ],
    "comparison_operator" : "eq",
    "period" : 1000
  },
  "state" : "insufficient data",
  "type" : "notification",
  "user_id" : "4a1beba01f6c4b10a2b0664f966435be"
}

this will create an alarm, when a notification type matches
site.* and the payload of the notification with network.name
equals word "example", and the age less than 5, an alarm will
be triggered. The period parameter indicates that the alarm state
will be set back to OK when time elapsed 1000 seconds or more
since the trigger time.

Change-Id: I3493ad23640e9ecac40b5c6a8b6cfb1eedb8b7ab
bp: alarm-on-notification

commit_message:
Display more specific error on image creation

When the creation of an image, whose size exceeds the limit set in quota,
is attempted, the error message displayed to the user is just a generic one.
Display a more detailed error message in this case.

Change-Id: Ib65b8966bc0c14708519cfb43991bf8643374225
Closes-Bug: #1270817

subject: Adds job filtering support to jobboards
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 14:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/jobs/jobboard.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py', 'taskflow/jobs/job.py'], 'message': 'Adds job filtering support to jobboards

Specify a topic when creating a job, then use the
topic kwarg of JobBoard.iterjobs to filter. A glob
can be specified when filtering.

Change-Id: Id0ed5e611c0c550873c24ecdbee9466c14a0574d
Implements: blueprint job-filtering
'}]
commit_message:
Adds job filtering support to jobboards

Specify a topic when creating a job, then use the
topic kwarg of JobBoard.iterjobs to filter. A glob
can be specified when filtering.

Change-Id: Id0ed5e611c0c550873c24ecdbee9466c14a0574d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-28 08:34:31.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/read_only.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_read_only.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Read-Only Middleware

commit_message:
Read-Only Middleware

What does 'read-only' mean ?
With read-only filter in the pipeline, only GET and HEAD requests are
allowed to pass through.

Functionality
This simple filter has two 'modes' of operation where in it can:
* Make the entire cluster/deployment as read-only.
* Make only selected accounts as read-only.

Caveats
* Accounts to be made read-only are listed in conf file.
* The read-only functionality is not user-specific like ACLs.

This change attempts to implement something similar to what
is descibed in the following blueprints:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/read-only-middleware
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/read-only-objects

Change-Id: If7fef080e36e5f6e3c34e032edc9d6148e3e86c2
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>

commit_message:
quota-delete changed to delete the quota for a specific resource

The quota-delete method receives a new optional parameter with the
resource to be deleted. This operation when receives a resource, resets
the quota to the default just for this specific resource.

This new parameter could go in both cases of quota-delete: with tenant
or with tenant and user.

This commit depends on the implementation done in nova with change:
I645b19203956a0ae79db6581b8615fc6c123fe6f

Change-Id: Ie05125329c9e84c5f441c3bd7301d1d9e908e108
Partial-Bug: #1064854

commit_message:
NSX: Fix status sync with correct mappings

The code that syncs router status to the neutron_db was using the nsx
router id instead of the neutron router id thus synchronize_router
would never update the database.

Also, the switch synchronization routine was not fetching the
appropriate neutron id tag thus causing switch synchronization to
be skipped.

This patch also fixes the error in the unit tests which allowed for
the bug to be introduced.

Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1283856

Conflicts:

	neutron/plugins/nicira/common/sync.py

Change-Id: I26342ecea6ad546b224b7fca1e55f754b4883363
(cherry picked from commit ec3dfc93da605b7c41682951f2fd1e27fb09d53b)

commit_message:
Use unminified javascript files

In Debian, minified javascript are considered either as an
obfuscation of the original code, or as a "compiled-in binary"
version of them, and therefore minified javascript files are
considered non-free.

Moreover, the use of unminified javascript will ease the
development on client side. There will be no impact on Horizon
performance due to the compress tag of Django.

This is a backport of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/67096/

Change-Id: Iadc1bd0bfad09eb418601134180eb8cc74671022
Closes-Bug: #1269727

subject: Fix evaluation_periods usage in DB2 engine
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-20 11:09:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/storage/test_pymongo_base.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_db2.py', 'tests/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': 'Fix evaluation_periods usage in DB2 engine

This bug was fixed on master along with a major refactoring of the
db2 storage engine that unified the mongo and db2 code as much as
possible. This refactoring was not merged back to stable/havana
but the bug exists there as well.

This patches fixes the evaluation_periods field name in the rule
encapsulation code. As tests existed for the mongo engine these
tests are now moved to a common place and extended to run on both
db2 and mongo engines.

The test uncovered another small difference between the two engines.
Db2 does not add type field for the query during the encapsulation.
This difference is resolved in the same way as on the master branch
by adding the type field also in db2.

Closes-Bug: #1281181
Change-Id: Ib6894c774ec3fe322a2b8a75cc036cedcee5ce43
'}]
commit_message:
Fix evaluation_periods usage in DB2 engine

This bug was fixed on master along with a major refactoring of the
db2 storage engine that unified the mongo and db2 code as much as
possible. This refactoring was not merged back to stable/havana
but the bug exists there as well.

This patches fixes the evaluation_periods field name in the rule
encapsulation code. As tests existed for the mongo engine these
tests are now moved to a common place and extended to run on both
db2 and mongo engines.

The test uncovered another small difference between the two engines.
Db2 does not add type field for the query during the encapsulation.
This difference is resolved in the same way as on the master branch
by adding the type field also in db2.

Closes-Bug: #1281181
Change-Id: Ib6894c774ec3fe322a2b8a75cc036cedcee5ce43

commit_message:
Add --dhcp-ip option to dhcp-agent-network-add

A part of blueprint enable-to-set-dhcp-port-attributes

The blueprint provides "add network to dhcp agent" API to enable to
specify DHCP port attributes. This patch is counterpart of CLI.

--dhcp-ip option is added to dhcp-agent-network-add to enable to
specify ip address[es] of the dhcp port. Other attributes of dhcp_port
can be specified by using 'values_specs'.

Usage:
neutron dhcp-agent-network-add --dhcp-ip ip_address=IP_ADDR dhcp_agent network
  --dhcp-ip ip_address=IP_ADDR
                Desired IP for dhcp port:
                subnet_id=<name_or_id>,ip_address=<ip>, (This option
                can be repeated.)
DocImpact

Change-Id: I71204987e01529734301d2437743deae3b868957

commit_message:
Add CLI support for service-context to insert service instance

CLI changes to support service-context which is provided as an
attribute during service creation. The service-context is specified
as key:value pairs where the value is a list of resources of the type
indicated by the key. router, network, subnet & port are supported.

Change-Id: I8b80c88b0ce0930b866796c49b87853b0a021afe
Implements: blueprint fwaas-service-insertion-cli

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Remove this config item because new configuration parameters should not be
introduced in stable backports.

Change-Id: Ie815e457c0b25ab828e780b5d90233ba0ceff61f
Closes-Bug: #1251026
(cherry picked from commit b22442a6b80c22f6e31d086263cdb77de10d92ef)

commit_message:
Raise max header size to accommodate large tokens

The max header is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Remove this config item because new configuration parameters should not be
introduced in stable backports.

Change-Id: Ie815e457c0b25ab828e780b5d90233ba0ceff61f
Closes-Bug: #1251026
(cherry picked from commit b22442a6b80c22f6e31d086263cdb77de10d92ef)

commit_message:
Release candidate updates for Networking chapter

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Networking chapter:

1) Moved Neutron ML2 sections before OVS sections and updated
   associated notes to steer users toward ML2.
2) Removed database population steps because Neutron populates the
   database at first run.
3) Moved 'enable_security_group' key to [securitygroup] section.
4) Removed extraneous colons from procedure titles.
5) Added command output to Neutron initial networks section.
6) Added command output to Nova initial networks section.

Change-Id: Ie677d199d2c64ef2a564eaa551295e1a321db02c
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

commit_message:
Add network parameters to Heat template creation.

In order to allow the allocation of a floating IP in the heat
template, we need to give network paremeters as input.

This patch :
- updates the heat template to associate a floating IP to the
created server
- Use python-neutronclient to find the needed network id to pass to
the heat template

Fixes bug 1301324

Change-Id: If6182d1bf6196022b77bfaf26d2563a483f1a460

commit_message:
Removes direct access of timeutils.override_time

The attribute "override_time" is a private attribute which
should only be set through "timeutils.set_time_override()".
There are a number of places in Ceilometer which the override_time
attribute is set directly and such behavior should be prohibited.

However the "set_time_override()" function along with "override_time"
in timeutils is planned to be removed, therefore we no longer
need to use it.

Change-Id: I6f3a5e0bb4e4c448f369dd5ead0e1525fd2262e6
Related-Bug: #1266962

subject: driver.create/remove_export() require elevated context
revisions:

The volume manager should call driver.create_export()
and driver.remove_export() with an elevated context.

This is already done for remove_export() in some cases
but not in initialize_connection error paths, or for
terminate_connection.

This will at a minimum cause issues with the LVM LIO
driver as its create/remove_export methods uses database
queries requiring admin access (volume_get_iscsi_target_num,
iscsi_target_count_by_host).

Partial-Bug: #1300148
Closes-Bug: #1305197

Change-Id: I5c1091cf9720ebccefc328b64fbf2982b3aac397
'}]
commit_message:
driver.create/remove_export() require elevated context

The volume manager should call driver.create_export()
and driver.remove_export() with an elevated context.

This is already done for remove_export() in some cases
but not in initialize_connection error paths, or for
terminate_connection.

This will at a minimum cause issues with the LVM LIO
driver as its create/remove_export methods uses database
queries requiring admin access (volume_get_iscsi_target_num,
iscsi_target_count_by_host).

Partial-Bug: #1300148
Closes-Bug: #1305197

Change-Id: I5c1091cf9720ebccefc328b64fbf2982b3aac397

Since newer versions of each package can either break
hacking(flake8, pep8) or introduce new rules and because we gate on
the output of hacking, we pin these dependencies to specific versions.

* Set pyflakes to the newest version: 0.8.1
* Set flake8 to to the newest version: 2.1.0
* Set pep8 to 1.4.6, since newer version (1.5.1) breaks hacking and will
  require additional work to support it. Will be addressed in a future
  patch.

Add the new versions along side the old versions so we don't create a
backwards incompatible global requirements change.

To support hacking change: Ia3495102a9d096c09802b9c079a8dc7ec1f65530

Change-Id: I5bebee5af87a75781b840daead61436af0d6ab3a
"}]
commit_message:
Bump pep8, pyflakes and flake8 versions

Since newer versions of each package can either break
hacking(flake8, pep8) or introduce new rules and because we gate on
the output of hacking, we pin these dependencies to specific versions.

* Set pyflakes to the newest version: 0.8.1
* Set flake8 to to the newest version: 2.1.0
* Set pep8 to 1.4.6, since newer version (1.5.1) breaks hacking and will
  require additional work to support it. Will be addressed in a future
  patch.

Add the new versions along side the old versions so we don't create a
backwards incompatible global requirements change.

To support hacking change: Ia3495102a9d096c09802b9c079a8dc7ec1f65530

Change-Id: I5bebee5af87a75781b840daead61436af0d6ab3a

Some configuration parameters used in neutron.agent.linux.utils
were missing. The namespace attribute in the FakeNetwork object
was missing, and used in neutron.agent.linux.dhcp. Also, the
plugin object was missing for release_dhcp_port operation.

We provide a fake plugin object to accept current and any future
plugin calls as this is meant to be an standalone tool that
should work without any RPC connectivity.

FakeNetwork was switched for neutron.agent.linux.dhcp.NetModel
to follow any future changes in NetModel.

Two wrong called_once_with_args calls without assert were fixed.

Change-Id: Ia51ea9bd4c8eea6b250858964ad5286c933702e0
Closes-Bug: #1291915
Partial-Bug: #1297875
'}]
commit_message:
fixes broken neutron-netns-cleanup

Some configuration parameters used in neutron.agent.linux.utils
were missing. The namespace attribute in the FakeNetwork object
was missing, and used in neutron.agent.linux.dhcp. Also, the
plugin object was missing for release_dhcp_port operation.

We provide a fake plugin object to accept current and any future
plugin calls as this is meant to be an standalone tool that
should work without any RPC connectivity.

FakeNetwork was switched for neutron.agent.linux.dhcp.NetModel
to follow any future changes in NetModel.

Two wrong called_once_with_args calls without assert were fixed.

Change-Id: Ia51ea9bd4c8eea6b250858964ad5286c933702e0
Closes-Bug: #1291915
Partial-Bug: #1297875

commit_message:
Revert "add mirror requirements list"

This reverts commit b1101620fc0ba1938708b2e93f529341a016f0ae.

The new thinking is that hacking itself should enforce that the
three hacking requirements are not in project's test requirements.

commit_message:
Updated Launch chapter

As part of the installation guide improvement project, I performed
the following operations on the Launch chapter:

1) Split monolithic file with instructions for nova networking into
   separate files for nova and neutron networking.
2) Updated instructions in each section to account for differences
   between nova and neutron networking.
3) Updated other sections and glossary as necessary.

Change-Id: I7faaadc0787cf85d816c7c2aab1247ecc77195b2
Partial-Bug: #1291071
Implements: blueprint networking-install-guide-improvements

commit_message:
Add EPEL-7 repo for RHEL7

* RHEL7 requires epel for many dependencies.
* The default RDO URL also switched to an icehouse version.
* RHEL6 RDO repo also will be configured for RHEL7, but the
  configuration variable name remains RHEL6_RDO_REPO_RPM for compatibility
  reasons.

Change-Id: I414c0f5357bf24c8d5657ea8231515461862e734

revisions:

Since in dev install guide we create a symlink to saharadashboard instead
of installing it, its dependencies are not installed automatically. So we
need to manually install saharaclient. Thanks to Yaroslav for finding
that issue.

Change-Id: I319ff3aaf6df86e473d4b0206f9769938074c6f8
(cherry picked from commit 01cc56d25d04a2f5a7b0c1ff32cf11b16c06edd0)
'}]
commit_message:
Saharaclient must be installed for UI to work in dev environment

Since in dev install guide we create a symlink to saharadashboard instead
of installing it, its dependencies are not installed automatically. So we
need to manually install saharaclient. Thanks to Yaroslav for finding
that issue.

Change-Id: I319ff3aaf6df86e473d4b0206f9769938074c6f8
(cherry picked from commit 01cc56d25d04a2f5a7b0c1ff32cf11b16c06edd0)

commit_message:
Squash alembic files.

This patch squashes all the alembic migration scripts
into one file.

I used the hash from the most recently added alembic
migration file. This is to make sure that a DB upgrade
is a noop if someone tries to redeploy the db on top
of an existing deployment.

Fixes bug 1298916

Change-Id: I17d1ccb3123346e9138ad1701fa5c6e1dd81529a

subject: Do not use the 'extend' method on a dict_items object
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-13 15:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Do not use the 'extend' method on a dict_items object

This method does not exist: it is meant to be used on a list. In Python 3,
keys() return a dict_items object, instead of a list in Python 2, so an error
happens. Fix this by converting the dict_items object  to a list before calling
extend().

This is enough to fix tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_models.py in Python 3, so
we can enable this test.

Change-Id: Ic09af6c084e89e19ddc60058270890dbe052c85e
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use the 'extend' method on a dict_items object

This method does not exist: it is meant to be used on a list. In Python 3,
keys() return a dict_items object, instead of a list in Python 2, so an error
happens. Fix this by converting the dict_items object  to a list before calling
extend().

This is enough to fix tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_models.py in Python 3, so
we can enable this test.

Change-Id: Ic09af6c084e89e19ddc60058270890dbe052c85e

subject: Don't call provision.py directly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 05:11:57.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': 'Don't call provision.py directly

When testr.conf calls the sqlalchemy/provision.py script directly,
sys.path[0] is the directory that invoked the script.  So when it
tries to import openstack.common.db you end up with an import failure.

---
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py", line 27, in <module>
    from openstack.common.db import exception as exc
ImportError: No module named openstack.common.db
---

The solution is to run it with -m

Closes-Bug: #1303579
Change-Id: Ia7ff187df1685f0dd5ef32c3f6de474218874b04
'}]
commit_message:
Don't call provision.py directly

When testr.conf calls the sqlalchemy/provision.py script directly,
sys.path[0] is the directory that invoked the script.  So when it
tries to import openstack.common.db you end up with an import failure.

---
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py", line 27, in <module>
    from openstack.common.db import exception as exc
ImportError: No module named openstack.common.db
---

The solution is to run it with -m

Closes-Bug: #1303579
Change-Id: Ia7ff187df1685f0dd5ef32c3f6de474218874b04

subject: GlusterFS: Delete active snapshot file on volume delete.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 8247, 'name': 'Thang Pham', 'email': 'thang.g.pham@gmail.com', 'username': 'thang.pham'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}, {'_account_id': 10725, 'name': 'Sergey Gotliv', 'email': 'sgotliv@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgotliv'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 16:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/glusterfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_glusterfs.py'], 'message': 'GlusterFS: Delete active snapshot file on volume delete.

If a snapshot is taken of a volume that is attached to an active
instance, the volume file used by the instance will be switched to
the new snapshot file that is created.  When you delete the
snapshot, the base volume file will be merged with the snapshot
file and the base volume is deleted.  Upon a deleting the active
volume, the active snapshot file is not deleted because it does not
have the expected name that cinder is looking for, i.e.
volume-<uuid>.  Instead, the snapshot file has the name
volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  This patch looks at the volume info
file to find any active snapshot file and properly delete it when
the volume is deleted.

Change-Id: Ib0af4401d839ec3bd1eb3a81e1671811e0d4a288
Closes-Bug: #1300303
'}]
commit_message:
GlusterFS: Delete active snapshot file on volume delete.

If a snapshot is taken of a volume that is attached to an active
instance, the volume file used by the instance will be switched to
the new snapshot file that is created.  When you delete the
snapshot, the base volume file will be merged with the snapshot
file and the base volume is deleted.  Upon a deleting the active
volume, the active snapshot file is not deleted because it does not
have the expected name that cinder is looking for, i.e.
volume-<uuid>.  Instead, the snapshot file has the name
volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  This patch looks at the volume info
file to find any active snapshot file and properly delete it when
the volume is deleted.

Change-Id: Ib0af4401d839ec3bd1eb3a81e1671811e0d4a288
Closes-Bug: #1300303

commit_message:
Fix tox does not pass arguments to nose

When testing with tox we currently cannot test a specific file, it
is due to the fact that tox does not pass the arguments to nose.

By adding {posargs} at the end of the tox target which are using
nose, we can now use all of its features

Change-Id: If59830669fabb704cb9b6348819c6cec4060088a
Closes-Bug: #1306016
Co-Authored-By: florent <florent.flament-ext@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Fix logging issue when services stop on py26

On older versions of python 2.6, exceptions would be spewed to the error
log whenever a service would stop.  This gets magnified by the
container-updater which seems to do it with every pass.  This catches
and squelches the error.

Change-Id: I128c09c240e768e8195af1f6fe79b10d4e432471
Closes-Bug: #1306027

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-09 17:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/tests.py'], 'message': 'Use eventlet instead of threading for timeout

The only explicit use of Python threading is found in the
testFileSizeLimit test. Using eventlet seems a bit easier to follow,
accomplishing the same goal, and does not constrain us to a
multi-threaded environment.

The chunks() and timeout() module level functions are only used by one
test each, so we just move them to those tests to indicate they are not
used globally.

Change-Id: I50b9fb798fbfd1d552b3c3f90309f6b86da34853
'}]
commit_message:
Use eventlet instead of threading for timeout

The only explicit use of Python threading is found in the
testFileSizeLimit test. Using eventlet seems a bit easier to follow,
accomplishing the same goal, and does not constrain us to a
multi-threaded environment.

The chunks() and timeout() module level functions are only used by one
test each, so we just move them to those tests to indicate they are not
used globally.

Change-Id: I50b9fb798fbfd1d552b3c3f90309f6b86da34853

commit_message:
Fix LBaaS Haproxy occurs error if no member is added

If no member is added and session_persistence.type=HTTP_COOKIE,
haproxy agent would kill existing instance or not deploy instance.
Closes-Bug: #1302283

Change-Id: I2883eb69b3262ac1fa3ffb46b52e0e27beb9d20d

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-09 22:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/244_increase_user_id_length_volume_usage_cache.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Update user_id length to match Keystone schema in volume_usage_cache

Update the maximum length to match the Keystone schema for maximum
user_id length in volume_usage_cache. In the case that Keystone were
to leverage the full varchar 64, there would potentially be data loss
and/or collision of user_ids across records.

This change originates from the conversation about increasing the
length of user_ids in Keystone:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-February/028125.html

Even with the length not changing, it is important to ensure there is no
loss of data/resolution when relying on user_id to identify users uniquely.

Closes-Bug: #1226171
Change-Id: I05a5644a29d6e2432311c2ee5331970d5e8b0683
'}]
commit_message:
Update user_id length to match Keystone schema in volume_usage_cache

Update the maximum length to match the Keystone schema for maximum
user_id length in volume_usage_cache. In the case that Keystone were
to leverage the full varchar 64, there would potentially be data loss
and/or collision of user_ids across records.

This change originates from the conversation about increasing the
length of user_ids in Keystone:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-February/028125.html

Even with the length not changing, it is important to ensure there is no
loss of data/resolution when relying on user_id to identify users uniquely.

Closes-Bug: #1226171
Change-Id: I05a5644a29d6e2432311c2ee5331970d5e8b0683

subject: Check for silent failure of tgtadm remove
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 01:01:56.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_iscsi.py', 'cinder/brick/iscsi/iscsi.py'], 'message': "Check for silent failure of tgtadm remove

In order to work around a failure to remove targets that
had a reconnect the force flag was added to the tgt delete cmd.
    (https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1159948)

It turns out there's a bug in tgt where some versions will
sometimes silently fail when using the force flag.
    (https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tgt/+bug/1305343)

The problem is that in the gates since we merged the force change
there's a very high number of cases where lvremove fails because
the device is still active.  It appears that this is a result of
the silent force failures in target.

This patch adds a simple check after the force target removal,
if it detects the target is still present it reverts back to the old
non-force method to catch the cases that don't actually need the
force option.

This is a work-around until the version of target in the distros
is updated and can be used reliably, but closes the gate issue
bug that was reported.

Change-Id: I9150669040815e4831bd570964d12676b83ecbc9
Close-Bug: #1304122
"}]
commit_message:
Check for silent failure of tgtadm remove

In order to work around a failure to remove targets that
had a reconnect the force flag was added to the tgt delete cmd.
    (https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1159948)

It turns out there's a bug in tgt where some versions will
sometimes silently fail when using the force flag.
    (https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/tgt/+bug/1305343)

The problem is that in the gates since we merged the force change
there's a very high number of cases where lvremove fails because
the device is still active.  It appears that this is a result of
the silent force failures in target.

This patch adds a simple check after the force target removal,
if it detects the target is still present it reverts back to the old
non-force method to catch the cases that don't actually need the
force option.

This is a work-around until the version of target in the distros
is updated and can be used reliably, but closes the gate issue
bug that was reported.

Change-Id: I9150669040815e4831bd570964d12676b83ecbc9
Close-Bug: #1304122

commit_message:
Set a correct whitelist for drivers in Ironic

Ironic recently introduced a feature called Drivers
whitelist. It allows to specify the drivers that are
enabled.

The default list is not appropriate for functional and
integration testing so devstack needs to be updated.

Change-Id: Iccc81343f4d5a7dec8b371934a8c9849d9ffac23

commit_message:
BigSwitch: Create router ports synchronously

Since router ports are created as part of a
long transaction with multiple REST calls, they
need to be created sychronously. This is to prevent
the async thread from deleting them from the backend
if it can't find them in cases where they haven't been
committed to the DB yet.

Closes-Bug: #1305331
Change-Id: I2ab3c862dc6b1760199654bbd0969ac5efdbe704

subject: Add BackOffLoopingCall with jitter
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-07 18:00:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/backoff.py', 'ironic_python_agent/backoff.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/ironic_api_client.py', 'ironic_python_agent/ironic_api_client.py'], 'message': 'Add BackOffLoopingCall with jitter

Using DynamicLoopingCall involved a few hacks to make it work properly. This
new BackOffLoopingCall will start an exponential backoff (with a configurable
jitter) when there is a failure. The backoff will continue until the given
function returns True or timeout is about to be exceeded. The function will
run indefinitely until either an exception is raised or timeout is reached.
I plan to merge this into oslo loopingcall and switch the heartbeat to this.

Change-Id: I1482348e98c6b68c34b3003645029e08135b1341
'}]
commit_message:
Add BackOffLoopingCall with jitter

Using DynamicLoopingCall involved a few hacks to make it work properly. This
new BackOffLoopingCall will start an exponential backoff (with a configurable
jitter) when there is a failure. The backoff will continue until the given
function returns True or timeout is about to be exceeded. The function will
run indefinitely until either an exception is raised or timeout is reached.
I plan to merge this into oslo loopingcall and switch the heartbeat to this.

Change-Id: I1482348e98c6b68c34b3003645029e08135b1341

subject: Fix logging issue when services stop on py26
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 19:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix logging issue when services stop on py26

On older versions of python 2.6, exceptions would be spewed to the error
log whenever a service would stop.  This gets magnified by the
container-updater which seems to do it with every pass.  This catches
and squelches the error.

Change-Id: I5944c1620c62cf0868b70dae7d7e2acd56bf8211
Closes-Bug: #1306027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logging issue when services stop on py26

On older versions of python 2.6, exceptions would be spewed to the error
log whenever a service would stop.  This gets magnified by the
container-updater which seems to do it with every pass.  This catches
and squelches the error.

Change-Id: I5944c1620c62cf0868b70dae7d7e2acd56bf8211
Closes-Bug: #1306027

subject: Restart only nova-compute when deploying Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 18:56:13.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Restart only nova-compute when deploying Ironic

lib/ironic redundantly restarts *all* Nova services as part of its bootstrap.
Only nova-compute should be restarted to ensure its resource tracker has picked
up newly enlisted Ironic nodes.  This change limits the restart to only
nova-compute and triggers it after nodes have been enlisted in Ironic.

Change-Id: I87a508d6611a16fa6b966ab18e15aa9fbcc5e8c7
'}]
commit_message:
Restart only nova-compute when deploying Ironic

lib/ironic redundantly restarts *all* Nova services as part of its bootstrap.
Only nova-compute should be restarted to ensure its resource tracker has picked
up newly enlisted Ironic nodes.  This change limits the restart to only
nova-compute and triggers it after nodes have been enlisted in Ironic.

Change-Id: I87a508d6611a16fa6b966ab18e15aa9fbcc5e8c7

subject: Use iniset for changing my.conf and avoid deprecated config options
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2062, 'name': 'Ralf Haferkamp', 'email': 'rhafer@suse.com', 'username': 'rhafer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-10 12:03:47.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql'], 'message': 'Use iniset for changing my.conf and avoid deprecated config options

The mysql config file is using INI format so use the iniset function to
manipulate it. This change also rearranges the config updates a bit
allowing us to make mulitple changes in a single sudo call. This reduces
the number of required process forks, and the number of times the 'functions'
file needs to be sourced a bit.

The "log-slow-queries" option is deprecated since mysql 5.1.29 and got
removed with 5.6.x. Use the newer slow-query-log-file/slow-query-log
settings instead. They are available since 5.1.12. This fixes a problem
with running devstack with mysql-5.6, which is e.g. part of openSUSE
13.1.

Change-Id: Iea28bf05c664b5387d51dae1a63a780344623596
'}]
commit_message:
Use iniset for changing my.conf and avoid deprecated config options

The mysql config file is using INI format so use the iniset function to
manipulate it. This change also rearranges the config updates a bit
allowing us to make mulitple changes in a single sudo call. This reduces
the number of required process forks, and the number of times the 'functions'
file needs to be sourced a bit.

The "log-slow-queries" option is deprecated since mysql 5.1.29 and got
removed with 5.6.x. Use the newer slow-query-log-file/slow-query-log
settings instead. They are available since 5.1.12. This fixes a problem
with running devstack with mysql-5.6, which is e.g. part of openSUSE
13.1.

Change-Id: Iea28bf05c664b5387d51dae1a63a780344623596

commit_message:
Update write-pip-manifests pip freeze to use -l

Update write-pip-manifests pip freeze to use -l so that output
manifests do not include non-virtualenv version info. So that
subsequent rebuilds with DIB_PIP_MANIFEST_<service> will work.

Change-Id: I9c3b0ba1595db6e4d970dcf3ceb9a03211f864b0
Closes-Bug: #1305859

subject: Add neutron_port resource
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6754, 'name': 'Mark T. Voelker', 'email': 'markvoelker@gmail.com', 'username': 'mvoelker'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 18:18:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/neutron_port.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_port/neutron.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_router_interface/neutron.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_router_interface.rb'], 'message': 'Add neutron_port resource

This resource is required to add more than a single router interface to
a neutron network or subnet. By default, using
`neutron_router_interface` to add a second router to a subnet without
first creating a port for it will cause IP conflicts.

This resource can be used to first retreive a non-conflicting ip on a
target network or subnet, then create a `neutron_router_interface` with
the port.

Eg:
```
neutron_router { $tenant:
  tenant_name          => $tenant,
  gateway_network_name => 'public',
  require              => [
    Neutron_network['private'],
    Neutron_subnet[$private_subnet],
  ],
} ->
neutron_port { "${tenant}_private":
  ensure       => present,
  network_name => 'private',
  subnet_name  => $private_subnet,
} ->
neutron_router_interface  { "${tenant}:${private_subnet}":
  ensure => present,
  port   => ${tenant}_private",
}
```

(cherry picked from commit 58d07a78c8d30f207c582e42a84a0a3660f738ac)

Change-Id: Ifdec5dce4576d51c6c95261469a4565807a34040
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron_port resource

This resource is required to add more than a single router interface to
a neutron network or subnet. By default, using
`neutron_router_interface` to add a second router to a subnet without
first creating a port for it will cause IP conflicts.

This resource can be used to first retreive a non-conflicting ip on a
target network or subnet, then create a `neutron_router_interface` with
the port.

Eg:
```
neutron_router { $tenant:
  tenant_name          => $tenant,
  gateway_network_name => 'public',
  require              => [
    Neutron_network['private'],
    Neutron_subnet[$private_subnet],
  ],
} ->
neutron_port { "${tenant}_private":
  ensure       => present,
  network_name => 'private',
  subnet_name  => $private_subnet,
} ->
neutron_router_interface  { "${tenant}:${private_subnet}":
  ensure => present,
  port   => ${tenant}_private",
}
```

(cherry picked from commit 58d07a78c8d30f207c582e42a84a0a3660f738ac)

Change-Id: Ifdec5dce4576d51c6c95261469a4565807a34040

commit_message:
Saharaclient must be installed for UI to work in dev environment

Since in dev install guide we create a symlink to saharadashboard instead
of installing it, its dependencies are not installed automatically. So we
need to manually install saharaclient. Thanks to Yaroslav for finding
that issue.

Change-Id: I319ff3aaf6df86e473d4b0206f9769938074c6f8
