commit_message:
Merge container storage_policy_index values.

Keep status_changed_at in container databases current with status changes that
occur as a result of container creation, deletion, or re-creation.

Merge container put/delete/created timestamps when handling replicate
responses from remote servers in addition to during the handling of the
REPLICATE request.

When storage policies are configured on a cluster send status_changed_at,
object_count and storage_policy_index as part of container replication sync
args.

Use status_changed_at during replication to determine the oldest active
container and merge storage_policy_index.

Change-Id: If3a6b405b9bed7f4c198a678c3e2991d4aeda63c

subject: Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10380, 'name': 'Josh Gachnang', 'email': 'josh@pcsforeducation.com', 'username': 'JoshNang'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 15:35:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/ironic_states.py'], 'message': "Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Also, the relevant code and tests underwent some refactoring to make
the code shorter and less nested.

Closes-Bug: #1300288
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4c7037d6c7b99548a646ef6665b29479277fb4d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Nova rescheduling tear down problem

If something fails in the spawn() method (e.g driver parameters, node
in maintenance mode) nova will try to rescheduler the instance (in case
the retry filter is enabled) as part of the rescheduling process nova
will call destroy() on that instance which was cause another problem
when Ironic tried to undeploy a node that wasn't deployed. This patch
is fixing the tear down problem by checking the provision_state of the
node before requesting Ironic to undeploy the node.

Also, the relevant code and tests underwent some refactoring to make
the code shorter and less nested.

Closes-Bug: #1300288
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4c7037d6c7b99548a646ef6665b29479277fb4d5

subject: Keep status_changed_at up-to-date with status changes.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-04 06:12:46.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db_replicator.py', 'bin/swift-container-info', 'swift/common/db_replicator.py', 'test/unit/account/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': 'Keep status_changed_at up-to-date with status changes.

In particular during container recreation and replication.

When a container-server receives a PUT for a deleted database an extra
UPDATE is issued against the container_stat table to notate the
x-timestamp of the request.

During replication if merge_timestamps causes a container's status to
change (from DELETED to ACTIVE or vice-versa) the status_changed_at
filed is set to the current time.

Accurate reporting of status_changed_at is useful for container
replication forensics and allows resolution of "set on create"
attributes.

Change-Id: I1bcac18d235be02662eb28481ed6f693922b928f
'}]
commit_message:
Keep status_changed_at up-to-date with status changes.

In particular during container recreation and replication.

When a container-server receives a PUT for a deleted database an extra
UPDATE is issued against the container_stat table to notate the
x-timestamp of the request.

During replication if merge_timestamps causes a container's status to
change (from DELETED to ACTIVE or vice-versa) the status_changed_at
filed is set to the current time.

Accurate reporting of status_changed_at is useful for container
replication forensics and allows resolution of "set on create"
attributes.

Change-Id: I1bcac18d235be02662eb28481ed6f693922b928f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-09 09:00:11.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_spec.rb', 'manifests/plugins/ml2.pp'], 'message': 'ml2-plugin: update security group option

In Icehouse, security group configuration is enabled from the plugin and
should be enabled by a boolean value instead of a firewall_driver like
before.
If security group is enable, we should ensure firewall_driver is true or
a specific driver.
If security group is disabled, we should use Noop firewall driver.
Patch in Icehouse: http://git.io/Bb-PHQ

Change-Id: I0d0ca2fb80d21a439c5e096dcd978e956e6662fd
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ml2-plugin: update security group option

In Icehouse, security group configuration is enabled from the plugin and
should be enabled by a boolean value instead of a firewall_driver like
before.
If security group is enable, we should ensure firewall_driver is true or
a specific driver.
If security group is disabled, we should use Noop firewall driver.
Patch in Icehouse: http://git.io/Bb-PHQ

Change-Id: I0d0ca2fb80d21a439c5e096dcd978e956e6662fd
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

subject: Move dnsmasq-neutron.conf into a subdir
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 14:37:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/networking/section_networking_introduction.xml'], 'message': "Move dnsmasq-neutron.conf into a subdir

Update our docs to suggest that the optional dnsmasq-neutron.conf
live in a subdirectory called 'dnsmasq'. This fixes potential
issues in following these instructions where Neutron
services may be configured to use --config-dir option which
would cause this .conf file (which is in a dnsmasq format)
gets picked up and thus causes service startup failures.

See also TripleO bug #1305254

Change-Id: I169cc54d534ed1e91550854722071858ea0d0069
"}]
commit_message:
Move dnsmasq-neutron.conf into a subdir

Update our docs to suggest that the optional dnsmasq-neutron.conf
live in a subdirectory called 'dnsmasq'. This fixes potential
issues in following these instructions where Neutron
services may be configured to use --config-dir option which
would cause this .conf file (which is in a dnsmasq format)
gets picked up and thus causes service startup failures.

See also TripleO bug #1305254

subject: simplify endpoint lookups
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-09 10:45:15.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/uri.rb', 'libraries/endpoints.rb'], 'message': "simplify endpoint lookups

We only need to check if the endpoint namespace hash contains a uri key in
one place. It makes sense to leave that check in 'uri_from_hash' and
remove it from 'endpoint'. This just makes following the logic a tiny
bit easier and removes redundant code.

Change-Id: Ie8e66ae3ab4204b2e96e8cba68f7294df8bd571b
"}]
commit_message:
simplify endpoint lookups

We only need to check if the endpoint namespace hash contains a uri key in
one place. It makes sense to leave that check in 'uri_from_hash' and
remove it from 'endpoint'. This just makes following the logic a tiny
bit easier and removes redundant code.

Change-Id: Ie8e66ae3ab4204b2e96e8cba68f7294df8bd571b

subject: Fix logging issue when services stop on py26
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 19:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix logging issue when services stop on py26

On older versions of python 2.6, exceptions would be spewed to the error
log whenever a service would stop.  This gets magnified by the
container-updater which seems to do it with every pass.  This catches
and squelches the error.

Change-Id: I128c09c240e768e8195af1f6fe79b10d4e432471
Closes-Bug: #1306027
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logging issue when services stop on py26

On older versions of python 2.6, exceptions would be spewed to the error
log whenever a service would stop.  This gets magnified by the
container-updater which seems to do it with every pass.  This catches
and squelches the error.

Change-Id: I128c09c240e768e8195af1f6fe79b10d4e432471
Closes-Bug: #1306027

subject: add mirror requirements list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 21:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'mirror-requirements.txt'], 'message': "add mirror requirements list

there are some packages we want in the mirror (at all versions)
however we don't want projects to be able to specify them directly,
because they are always going to have versions specified by other
libraries.

The current mirror process processes things that look like
requirements files from global-requirements, so let us specify
these additional mirror requirements here.

Change-Id: I7436cf84f58cabe97e6fa8df2be43bc44061d8ba
"}]
commit_message:
add mirror requirements list

there are some packages we want in the mirror (at all versions)
however we don't want projects to be able to specify them directly,
because they are always going to have versions specified by other
libraries.

The current mirror process processes things that look like
requirements files from global-requirements, so let us specify
these additional mirror requirements here.

Change-Id: I7436cf84f58cabe97e6fa8df2be43bc44061d8ba

commit_message:
Use provides to note an element provides an OS

Use "operating-system" to denote that an element provides that to the
image being created.  This can then be used to specify an abstract
dependency in other elements to assist in build-time image verification.

Change-Id: Ic125803da65e0f8f8c20ef90b08815f4f7d09762

subject: Close file handle after use
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-10 18:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/hardware.py'], 'message': 'Close file handle after use

The file handle for addr_info was left open, meaning we were leaking
file handles when sending system information. This ensures the handle is
closed.

Change-Id: I4b117d4f9ec32ad3f16f43632ffe9dc96da5ab7f
'}]
commit_message:
Close file handle after use

The file handle for addr_info was left open, meaning we were leaking
file handles when sending system information. This ensures the handle is
closed.

Change-Id: I4b117d4f9ec32ad3f16f43632ffe9dc96da5ab7f

subject: Add a note that the glance-registry is internal
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-10 17:19:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/section_getstart_image.xml'], 'message': 'Add a note that the glance-registry is internal

Users could be confused into thinking the glance registry
is an external-facing service. It is not, and is designed
with a security model such that it should be protected for
internal use only.

This patch adds a note to the introduction in the common section
so it will be included in multiple guides.

Change-Id: Ic540353d82c829475ac6f3455ccccdea32977a4b
Closes-Bug: 1252931
'}]
commit_message:
Add a note that the glance-registry is internal

Users could be confused into thinking the glance registry
is an external-facing service. It is not, and is designed
with a security model such that it should be protected for
internal use only.

This patch adds a note to the introduction in the common section
so it will be included in multiple guides.

Change-Id: Ic540353d82c829475ac6f3455ccccdea32977a4b
Closes-Bug: 1252931

subject: don't use pip -e install for libraries
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 10:36:29.000000000', 'files': ['clean.sh', 'lib/oslo', 'functions', 'lib/stackforge', 'lib/infra'], 'message': "don't use pip -e install for libraries

libraries in openstack shouldn't be installed editable, as it
causes all manner of issues (especially complicated by the use
of namespace packages). Install these globally as part of the
devstack installation process.

Change-Id: I11acb169e74069be0618e57496ff342f9e788493
"}]
commit_message:
don't use pip -e install for libraries

libraries in openstack shouldn't be installed editable, as it
causes all manner of issues (especially complicated by the use
of namespace packages). Install these globally as part of the
devstack installation process.

Change-Id: I11acb169e74069be0618e57496ff342f9e788493

commit_message:
Allow user to specify image to use during rescue

This commit includes the compute changes to accept a parameter
rescue_image_ref in the rescue_instance method.
If specified, this image_ref will be used to rescue the instance.
If the image is not specified, then the base image ref is used by default.

Partially Implements: blueprint allow-image-to-be-specified-during-rescue

DocImpact

Change-Id: I59311fcfcb8eb54701618e92e5cdada109235b38

commit_message:
Separate OSTF and Postgres from nailgun

Enables capability to install nailgun and
OSTF without postgres server for Docker
installation. OSTF moved out of base
Nailgun class so it can be installed
separately. Database paramters are
explicitly declared for OSTF both in
the class and in service definitions.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: I841c328ab932c54ad44e33018511be9c1d5220b3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 11:04:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': 'Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError. It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from. There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

This fix has already been merged into oslo.messaging.

--

Cherry-picked from oslo-incubator 234f64d608266f43d8856ff98c89ceba6699d752
See also https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086077

Closes-bug: #1303890
Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0
'}]
commit_message:
Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError. It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from. There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

This fix has already been merged into oslo.messaging.

--

Cherry-picked from oslo-incubator 234f64d608266f43d8856ff98c89ceba6699d752
See also https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086077

Closes-bug: #1303890
Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0

commit_message:
Activate venvs in os-*-config elements source install

  This updates the source install scripts for os-apply collect and
  refresh config elements to activate their virtualenvs before
  performing pip installs,  as without this specifing a manifest for
  e.g. os-apply-config breaks devtest build

Closes-bug: #1305151
Change-Id: I3c42de180f76fb122637c801541f14e50169de89

subject: Create copy of scenario context before modifying
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 14:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/runners/base.py'], 'message': 'Create copy of scenario context before modifying

Currently ScenarioRunner.run actually modifies the context attribute of
the scenarion function, when that scenario is run. This could cause
differente behaviour on subsequent runs of a scenario. It also causes
problems in unit tests as sample data passed into run() gets applied to
the scenario function, which causes subsequent tests to fail.

This patch uses copy.deepcopy to take a copy of the scenario context
before modifying it.

Change-Id: I101ed35998d82f6dcf11e603b9b0cda97bf8dbb1
Closes-Bug: #1305783
'}]
commit_message:
Create copy of scenario context before modifying

Currently ScenarioRunner.run actually modifies the context attribute of
the scenarion function, when that scenario is run. This could cause
differente behaviour on subsequent runs of a scenario. It also causes
problems in unit tests as sample data passed into run() gets applied to
the scenario function, which causes subsequent tests to fail.

This patch uses copy.deepcopy to take a copy of the scenario context
before modifying it.

Change-Id: I101ed35998d82f6dcf11e603b9b0cda97bf8dbb1
Closes-Bug: #1305783

subject: Add [<service>-bind] attributes to each service namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-10 09:25:17.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb'], 'message': 'Add [<service>-bind] attributes to each service namespace

Similar to what already existed for identity, this change adds a pair of *-bind
attributes for each service.  This allows for specifying a different
bind host or interface to actually bind a service to on each host, versus the
endpoint for the service which may be a separate IP on a load balancer.

This change is a pre-requisite change needed for the subsequent work in
each cookbook.

Change-Id: I3b0ee00a72bbe786b4ed399f79bb3c6f4c46167f
'}]
commit_message:
Add [<service>-bind] attributes to each service namespace

Similar to what already existed for identity, this change adds a pair of *-bind
attributes for each service.  This allows for specifying a different
bind host or interface to actually bind a service to on each host, versus the
endpoint for the service which may be a separate IP on a load balancer.

This change is a pre-requisite change needed for the subsequent work in
each cookbook.

Change-Id: I3b0ee00a72bbe786b4ed399f79bb3c6f4c46167f

subject: code hygiene; use six.text_type, escape regexp's, use key function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 18:03:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/fakeldap.py'], 'message': "code hygiene; use six.text_type, escape regexp's, use key function

Some simple code clean up for code hygiene

Need to use unicode() rather than str() to properly handle non-ascii
characters, but to be PY2/PY3 compatible use six.text_type.

Regexp's were formed by string formatting using run-time substitutions
but the substitutions were not escaped. If the substituion contained
regexp metachars the regexp could fail.

The db key was formed by string substituion but this code was
duplicated in many places, introduce a method, key() to eliminate the
code duplication. At the same time introduce the dn() method to
transform the dn to an internal format. Currently the dn() method is a
place holder whose implementation will be added in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I1fbb8cf420606c77b1eed346376050f21790a8e1
"}]
commit_message:
code hygiene; use six.text_type, escape regexp's, use key function

Some simple code clean up for code hygiene

Need to use unicode() rather than str() to properly handle non-ascii
characters, but to be PY2/PY3 compatible use six.text_type.

Regexp's were formed by string formatting using run-time substitutions
but the substitutions were not escaped. If the substituion contained
regexp metachars the regexp could fail.

The db key was formed by string substituion but this code was
duplicated in many places, introduce a method, key() to eliminate the
code duplication. At the same time introduce the dn() method to
transform the dn to an internal format. Currently the dn() method is a
place holder whose implementation will be added in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I1fbb8cf420606c77b1eed346376050f21790a8e1

subject: Refactor LDAP API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 18:03:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_ldap_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/keystone.db', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'Refactor LDAP API

The fake LDAP API must emulate the python-ldap API as much as possible
otherwise much of the LDAP testing is invalid. The python-ldap API
only accepts utf-8 encoded strings. However, the fake LDAP API accepts
any Python type therefore properly handling type conversion into and
out of the LDAP API is not exercised by the fake LDAP API during
testing. Currently type conversion is done inside the LdapWrapper
which calls the python-ldap API, this means unicode issues only appear
when testing with a live LDAP server.

LdapWrapper and FakeLdap logically are two different providers of the
same API, as such they should behave identically. Which LDAP API is
used at run time a configurable option.

We need a mechanism by which we can substitute an LDAP API and then
wrap the calls to that API with type conversions. Type conversion
wrapping replaces the Python types used in Keystone with the types
needed for the LDAP API, calls the LDAP API, and then type converts
the results back from LDAP to those used by Keystone.

This patch establishes an LDAP API interface (LDAPHandler), modifies
fake LDAP to support it, replaces LdapWrapper with the interface
(invoking python-ldap) and adds another LDAPHandler instance which
will be the common location for type conversions prior to calling the
configured LDAP interface. See the LDAPHandler class definition for
details).

This patch is exclusively a refactoring patch anticipating a
subsequent patch to properly handle unicode values. There is no
significant change in functionality with this patch, it is just
refactoring to more cleanly seperate API boundaries. A few tests which
exercised unicode were disabled in this patch because they will not
work until the next patch which adds back in correct unicode
handling. The idea here is to separate out the refactoring needed to
support unicode from the actual unicode changes, this should make
reviewing easier.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: I7db24040689245a616332b08744f40ab8381579d
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor LDAP API

The fake LDAP API must emulate the python-ldap API as much as possible
otherwise much of the LDAP testing is invalid. The python-ldap API
only accepts utf-8 encoded strings. However, the fake LDAP API accepts
any Python type therefore properly handling type conversion into and
out of the LDAP API is not exercised by the fake LDAP API during
testing. Currently type conversion is done inside the LdapWrapper
which calls the python-ldap API, this means unicode issues only appear
when testing with a live LDAP server.

LdapWrapper and FakeLdap logically are two different providers of the
same API, as such they should behave identically. Which LDAP API is
used at run time a configurable option.

We need a mechanism by which we can substitute an LDAP API and then
wrap the calls to that API with type conversions. Type conversion
wrapping replaces the Python types used in Keystone with the types
needed for the LDAP API, calls the LDAP API, and then type converts
the results back from LDAP to those used by Keystone.

This patch establishes an LDAP API interface (LDAPHandler), modifies
fake LDAP to support it, replaces LdapWrapper with the interface
(invoking python-ldap) and adds another LDAPHandler instance which
will be the common location for type conversions prior to calling the
configured LDAP interface. See the LDAPHandler class definition for
details).

This patch is exclusively a refactoring patch anticipating a
subsequent patch to properly handle unicode values. There is no
significant change in functionality with this patch, it is just
refactoring to more cleanly seperate API boundaries. A few tests which
exercised unicode were disabled in this patch because they will not
work until the next patch which adds back in correct unicode
handling. The idea here is to separate out the refactoring needed to
support unicode from the actual unicode changes, this should make
reviewing easier.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: I7db24040689245a616332b08744f40ab8381579d

subject: Properly handle unicode & utf-8 in LDAP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-07 18:03:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_ldap_livetest.py', 'keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': "Properly handle unicode & utf-8 in LDAP

This patch adds all the necessary type conversions between the LDAP
API's.

* string literals are unicode

* unicode strings are utf-8 encoded before calling LDAP

* utf-8 strings received from the LDAP API are decoded into unicode

* string classes use the six.text_type for Python 2 vs. Python 3
  compatibility

* the fake LDAP implementation was reworked such that it's external
  API only handles UTF-8 encoded strings but only uses unicode
  internally. This is because internally it must be able to operate on
  logical characters in order to perform string operations on it's
  data. This is very much akin to what happens in a real LDAP
  implementation, the interface is UTF-8 but operations occur on
  decoded logical characters.

Unicode tests that were skipped are now re-enabled.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: Icce6b508f748214e241de40c3c9389b2caccea83
"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle unicode & utf-8 in LDAP

This patch adds all the necessary type conversions between the LDAP
API's.

* string literals are unicode

* unicode strings are utf-8 encoded before calling LDAP

* utf-8 strings received from the LDAP API are decoded into unicode

* string classes use the six.text_type for Python 2 vs. Python 3
  compatibility

* the fake LDAP implementation was reworked such that it's external
  API only handles UTF-8 encoded strings but only uses unicode
  internally. This is because internally it must be able to operate on
  logical characters in order to perform string operations on it's
  data. This is very much akin to what happens in a real LDAP
  implementation, the interface is UTF-8 but operations occur on
  decoded logical characters.

Unicode tests that were skipped are now re-enabled.

Partial-Bug: 1172106
Change-Id: Icce6b508f748214e241de40c3c9389b2caccea83

Very few of the ldap tests were using non-ascii values, in fact
non-ascii values were restricted to only specific tests that
had 'unicode' in their test name. This is very weak test coverage.

This patch replaces all occurances of 'fake1', the standard string
used in the tests for test value with 'fäké1' where the a has an
umlaut and the e has a diacritical. Visually they look almost the
same but will trigger the type of encoding exceptions we've seen
in the past.

Closes-Bug: 1172106

Change-Id: I03b10f3da93a8fb388baacb00532c03019f327c0
"}]
commit_message:
Expand the use of non-ascii values in ldap test

Very few of the ldap tests were using non-ascii values, in fact
non-ascii values were restricted to only specific tests that
had 'unicode' in their test name. This is very weak test coverage.

This patch replaces all occurances of 'fake1', the standard string
used in the tests for test value with 'fäké1' where the a has an
umlaut and the e has a diacritical. Visually they look almost the
same but will trigger the type of encoding exceptions we've seen
in the past.

Closes-Bug: 1172106

Change-Id: I03b10f3da93a8fb388baacb00532c03019f327c0

commit_message:
once more into the breach, good friends

If both certificates get fetched via other threads, the check was improperly reporting an error
this gives it one more chance after a failure.

Closes-Bug: 1285833

commit_message:
Python 3: fix tests on HTTP headers

HTTP headers are encoded to bytes. Store headers at (key, value) tuples instead
of Unicode strings.

Check also that non-ASCII Unicode headers are encoded to UTF-8.

Change-Id: Ie45f5a5ba63f539a723a7ac5649779d8efb3e912

commit_message:
Verify more information for pools in lbaas tests

Add checks for:

 - Create a pool from an admin user for a tenant id other than its own
 - List or show the vip that a pool is associated with
 - Update a pool description and confirm it was changed with a show
 - Update the lb_method of a pool to other than Round_robin
 - Update the list of health monitors a pool is associated with
 - Show the members associated with a pool
 - Update the admin_state_up of a pool to false and confirm with show

partially implement bp: improve-neutron-test-coverage

Change-Id: I1dea0fad3ccf54a8f6844c4c71a542b4ee0e82cc

commit_message:
Allow a volume to be rolled back to its snapshot

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-rollback-snapshot

This action allows a volume to revert to a selected snapshot. The
rollback action will trigger a popup that allows the user to select
a previously taken snapshot for the rollback process.

Change-Id: I476420e62fc4197c985bfa56abd9cc5ad52a2bbe

subject: Allow a volume to be rolled back to its snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-13 02:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_volume_rpcapi.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Allow a volume to be rolled back to its snapshot

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-rollback-snapshot

It makes sense to be able to revert a volume to previously taken
snapshots.

The roll-back function can be used to revert a volume to a
previous snapshot, restoring the volume to the state at the time
the snapshot was taken. Then function supports roll-back to any
previously taken snapshot on the volume (we will can it the roll-
back snapshot in the document to distinguish it from other
snapshots).

The roll-back process will overwrite the existing volume with
data from the rollback snapshot; all other snapshot taken after
the rollback snapshot will be deleted.

Change-Id: Iea0c0040a542e9bfbb05590ea07ad7accec5d9bc
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a volume to be rolled back to its snapshot

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-rollback-snapshot

It makes sense to be able to revert a volume to previously taken
snapshots.

The roll-back function can be used to revert a volume to a
previous snapshot, restoring the volume to the state at the time
the snapshot was taken. Then function supports roll-back to any
previously taken snapshot on the volume (we will can it the roll-
back snapshot in the document to distinguish it from other
snapshots).

The roll-back process will overwrite the existing volume with
data from the rollback snapshot; all other snapshot taken after
the rollback snapshot will be deleted.

Change-Id: Iea0c0040a542e9bfbb05590ea07ad7accec5d9bc

subject: Remove 'persistent' parameter for boot device in PXE driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 08:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py'], 'message': "Remove 'persistent' parameter for boot device in PXE driver

Set persistent boot device requires 'ADMINISTRATOR' IPMI privilege
level. For others privilege levels deploy will be failed with this
option even if set boot device allowed.

Change-Id: Id0c598f6119fce1af7e77cb018a376348e2d3229
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'persistent' parameter for boot device in PXE driver

Set persistent boot device requires 'ADMINISTRATOR' IPMI privilege
level. For others privilege levels deploy will be failed with this
option even if set boot device allowed.

Change-Id: Id0c598f6119fce1af7e77cb018a376348e2d3229

     miimon => 100,

Change-Id: I260cf17eb5a4ee4ca89235ccd4db8e63498fa13d

commit_message:
Refactor native linux bonding

It's a stage #1 of blueprint linux-bonding :
  Refactoring incoming parameters for puppet ifconfig resource.
  Now we should use bond_properties hash instead set of dedicated parameters (backward compotibility saved).
  bond_properties => {
     mode   => 1, # mode is a obligatory option
     miimon => 100,
     ....
  }
  Full set of properties we can see here: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt

Implements: blueprint linux-bonding
Change-Id: I260cf17eb5a4ee4ca89235ccd4db8e63498fa13d

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent security group ICMP rules

Converts ICMP protocol to the equivalent protocol number.
Adds default ICMP reject rules.
Adds default ANY protocol rules if the rule does not
contain any protocol.

Closes-Bug: #1299159
Change-Id: Iff51a58fdb532eda0fe7a63abf96004ee74bb073

commit_message:
Set correct columns' length

In migration 569e98a8132b_metering incorrect length is set for
description column (255 instead of 1024) and in migration
39cf3f799352_fwaas_havana_2_model for firewall_rules table
incorrect length is set  for protocol column (24 instead of 40).

partially implement bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I0b2cb00c3bd2cd2ac7e002c861095129e5b5aa96

subject: Allows user-specified PXE timeout for overcloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-10 09:36:29.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh'], 'message': 'Allows user-specified PXE timeout for overcloud

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86523/2 makes the PXE deploy timeout
into a configurable value.  This patch allows the user to specify that
value, and depends on the other one being merged first, as well as the
dependent patch in tripleo-incubator.

Change-Id: I38e8cc0d8a677fef8c7547a679a23aa6e7da192e
'}]
commit_message:
Allows user-specified PXE timeout for overcloud

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86523/2 makes the PXE deploy timeout
into a configurable value.  This patch allows the user to specify that
value, and depends on the other one being merged first, as well as the
dependent patch in tripleo-incubator.

Change-Id: I38e8cc0d8a677fef8c7547a679a23aa6e7da192e

This commit adds 2 fixes to the add-service-tags spec file. The first

commit_message:
Add some fixes to the service-tag spec

This commit adds 2 fixes to the add-service-tags spec file. The first
is that it removes the '#' from the license statement at the top of
the file. These were unnecessary and it messes with the formatting from
a generated doc. The second fix is add a missing work item from the
list at the bottom of the spec.

Change-Id: Icf54f0ea95217aeb026eb788b960d87682b4a8ec

commit_message:
Optimize checks to set image properties in metadata

This cleans up the redundant checks we have around
instance.image and ensure we only check if image info
exists once and set the appropriate values and default
to None if missing. Also updated the tests to use the
right default of None instead of empty string and
None assert check for image and new test to validate
image from conductor with no links.

Change-Id: Idb4aa85ae132ec60175ada8a6e304c7eb27f485b

revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2014-04-10 07:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-undercloud-passwords', 'scripts/devtest_end.sh', 'scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh', 'scripts/devtest_variables.sh', 'scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh', 'scripts/setup-overcloud-passwords', 'scripts/write-tripleorc'], 'message': "Standardise location of environment password/rc files.

Discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/82807 highlighted the fact
that although our scripts consistently write the environment rc files
into $TRIPLEO_ROOT/, the password files are dropped in
whatever directory the user happened to run the scripts from.

Ideally these should be collected into a heat json environment file
which heat can use directly and we can query via jq; as an intermediate
step while we sort that out, this change makes sure that they at least
get written out to $TRIPLEO_ROOT/, alongside the other artifacts we
generate during a devtest run.

write-tripleorc likewise defaulted to creating a tripleorc in whatever
location the user happened to be in at the time, so I've given it
similar treatment to standardise the location of the tripleorc file.

Along the way, stevek objected to having if/then on separate lines. As
the instances in these scripts were 2/3eds of all such occurrences in the
scripts directory, I let my preference for this style override my
preference not to make unrelated stylistic changes in the same commit as
substantive changes.

Change-Id: I30a2cc4f406122bb038d314a277c2444182bd0c9
"}]
commit_message:
Standardise location of environment password/rc files.

Discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/82807 highlighted the fact
that although our scripts consistently write the environment rc files
into $TRIPLEO_ROOT/, the password files are dropped in
whatever directory the user happened to run the scripts from.

Ideally these should be collected into a heat json environment file
which heat can use directly and we can query via jq; as an intermediate
step while we sort that out, this change makes sure that they at least
get written out to $TRIPLEO_ROOT/, alongside the other artifacts we
generate during a devtest run.

write-tripleorc likewise defaulted to creating a tripleorc in whatever
location the user happened to be in at the time, so I've given it
similar treatment to standardise the location of the tripleorc file.

Along the way, stevek objected to having if/then on separate lines. As
the instances in these scripts were 2/3eds of all such occurrences in the
scripts directory, I let my preference for this style override my
preference not to make unrelated stylistic changes in the same commit as
substantive changes.

Change-Id: I30a2cc4f406122bb038d314a277c2444182bd0c9

Remove "reuse_existing" from setup method in dhcp.py

This flag is never used, it's always set to True by
DhcpLocalProcess.enable()

commit_message:
Check add/remove flavor access APIs attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2/V3 add & remove flavor
access APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema to
block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of V2 & V3 for add & remove flavor access APIs are same
and given below:

{
    "flavor_access": [
        {
            "flavor_id": "10",
            "tenant_id": "fake_tenant"
        }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I0e876494b9d1bda418076844ed3211f5513af76c

subject: Allow NotFound to be created without args
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-09 02:40:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py'], 'message': 'Allow NotFound to be created without args

It appears that the serialization used to wrap RPC exceptions
requires that the class be instantiated without any arguments.

Since the NotFound exception required a msg_fmt it could not be
deserialized in heat-api, which lead to no mapping in the FaultWrapper
so a 500 was raised instead of a 404.

This change adds a default value for msg_fmt for the NotFound exception.

The classes Error and ResourceFailure likely have this issue too, but it
is not as serious since they will raise a 500 error anyway.

Config/deployment API tests now check that NotFound can be deserialized by
calling to_remote_error, and checks that FaultWrapper converts that to
HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: Ieb8de26465cb26aa015f15c134f80a06ebcae95c
Closes-Bug: #1301657
Related-Bug: #1304743'}]
commit_message:
Allow NotFound to be created without args

It appears that the serialization used to wrap RPC exceptions
requires that the class be instantiated without any arguments.

Since the NotFound exception required a msg_fmt it could not be
deserialized in heat-api, which lead to no mapping in the FaultWrapper
so a 500 was raised instead of a 404.

This change adds a default value for msg_fmt for the NotFound exception.

The classes Error and ResourceFailure likely have this issue too, but it
is not as serious since they will raise a 500 error anyway.

Config/deployment API tests now check that NotFound can be deserialized by
calling to_remote_error, and checks that FaultWrapper converts that to
HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: Ieb8de26465cb26aa015f15c134f80a06ebcae95c
Closes-Bug: #1301657
Related-Bug: #1304743

commit_message:
Remove testscenarios load_tests

A load_tests call sneaked in test_provider_template, but it's become
useless since we switch to a base heat test class that provides what's
needed.

Qcow2TestCase had exact copies of two tests in the parent
_ImageTestCase so remove them. I'm assuming the tests originated
in Qcow2TestCase but later more image types were added and the

applied to all types of images, but the redundant tests from

commit_message:
Remove redundant tests from Qcow2TestCase

Qcow2TestCase had exact copies of two tests in the parent
_ImageTestCase so remove them. I'm assuming the tests originated
in Qcow2TestCase but later more image types were added and the
tests were pulled up into the common parent mixin since they
applied to all types of images, but the redundant tests from
Qcow2TestCase weren't cleaned up.

Related-Bug: #1302211

Change-Id: I031516b555ead5a3769fb62d90e373aac1b6baf1

subject: Don't disguise CFN API exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-10 07:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/wsgi.py', 'heat/common/serializers.py', 'heat/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "Don't disguise CFN API exceptions

The exception disguise wrapper is for the native API which uses
the faultwrap filter to process the response. For HeatAPIException
subclasses (which are only raised by the CFN/CW API's) we need to
raise the unwrapped exception or the client sees a 500 response.

Change-Id: Iebfbc76d5cb26aa9ee61c5192d7fecc596aa83b9
Closes-Bug: #1291079
"}]
commit_message:
Don't disguise CFN API exceptions

The exception disguise wrapper is for the native API which uses
the faultwrap filter to process the response. For HeatAPIException
subclasses (which are only raised by the CFN/CW API's) we need to
raise the unwrapped exception or the client sees a 500 response.

Change-Id: Iebfbc76d5cb26aa9ee61c5192d7fecc596aa83b9
Closes-Bug: #1291079

commit_message:
Refactor to separate serializers from wsgi controller

Remove the serializers from heat.common.wsgi, so we break the
circular import which happens if you want to import
heat.api.aws.exceptions to do a determination based on exception
type, which is required to avoid the faultwrap exception disguise
which is not applicable to the CFN API.

Partial-Bug: #1291079

Change-Id: I7498d78f8ec6098b28fb183eaaa04aa81fced3eb

commit_message:
Dedicated exception for PR malformed requirements

Create dedicated manager exception MalformedRequirements returns
HTTP 400 Malformed requirements %(rqrms)s
when the requirements of reservation are malformed

Added small bugfix allow to create reservation
with one character value of propety

Closes-Bug: #1305048
Change-Id: I5e5fa012dd9556182eac8def0124fa683f9b677c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-31 14:00:57.000000000', 'files': ['utils/pairwise_testcases.py', 'fuelweb_test/requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Script to generate test cases according to pairwise methodology

The script should be adjusted before using. You may
change parameters and rules lists to do it.

You need to install following python package:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/AllPairs/2.0.1

Run it as ordinary python script. Generated test cases
will be printed in stdout as a list of parameters
combinations.

Change-Id: I1bce9d8bfd5cb20a266fc4f1d7b285889d9c3d7d
'}]
commit_message:
Script to generate test cases according to pairwise methodology

The script should be adjusted before using. You may
change parameters and rules lists to do it.

You need to install following python package:
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/AllPairs/2.0.1

Run it as ordinary python script. Generated test cases
will be printed in stdout as a list of parameters
combinations.

Change-Id: I1bce9d8bfd5cb20a266fc4f1d7b285889d9c3d7d

commit_message:
Handling validation in conductor consistently

Change where we do validation in change_node_power_state to follow
where we do it for do_node_deploy and vendor_passthrough. That
is, we perform validation synchronously before we spawn off a
thread to perform the longer running action.

Change-Id: Ic1f791bb5ef49c033e4baff8d3f6900091dbf332
Closes-bug: #1294676

subject: GET details REST API next link missing 'details'
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 1773, 'name': 'oliver-leahy-l', 'email': 'oliver.leahy@hpe.com', 'username': 'oliver-leahy-l'}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9533, 'name': 'Eiichi Aikawa', 'email': 'aikawa@mxk.nes.nec.co.jp', 'username': 'EiichiAikawa'}, {'_account_id': 10559, 'name': 'Steven Kaufer', 'email': 'kaufer@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kaufer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 20:34:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/views/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/common.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': 'GET details REST API next link missing 'details'

When executing a pagination query a "next" link is included in the
API reply when there are more items then the specified limit.

See pagination documentation for more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/
Paginated_Collections-d1e664.html

The caller should be able to invoke the "next" link (without
having to re-format it) in order to get the next page of data.
The documentation states "Subsequent links will honor the
initial page size. Thus, a client may follow links to traverse
a paginated collection without having to input the marker parameter."

The problem is that the "next" link is always scoped to the non-
detailed query.

For example, if you execute "/v2/<tenant>/volumes/detail?limit=1",
the "next" link does not have the URL for a detailed query and is
formatted as "/v2/<tenant>/volumes?limit=1&marker=<marker>". In this
case the "next" link needs to be scoped to "/v2/<tenant>/volumes/detail".

The user could work around this issue my manually inserting '/details'
into the "next" link URL.

Test code is included to verify that the '/details' URL is correctly added
when the "next" link is included in a detailed pagination query. Also,
existing tests were changed to ensure that the correct controller function
(ie, 'index' vs. 'detail) are invoked for the appropriate query
(ie, non-detailed or detailed) -- 'index' was previously alwayed invoked
for detailed URL requests.

Change-Id: Ib00d6deb25255fac1db0f7bf4ecd3c8d30e1c39d
Closes-bug: 1299247
'}]
commit_message:
GET details REST API next link missing 'details'

When executing a pagination query a "next" link is included in the
API reply when there are more items then the specified limit.

See pagination documentation for more information:
http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/
Paginated_Collections-d1e664.html

The caller should be able to invoke the "next" link (without
having to re-format it) in order to get the next page of data.
The documentation states "Subsequent links will honor the
initial page size. Thus, a client may follow links to traverse
a paginated collection without having to input the marker parameter."

The problem is that the "next" link is always scoped to the non-
detailed query.

For example, if you execute "/v2/<tenant>/volumes/detail?limit=1",
the "next" link does not have the URL for a detailed query and is
formatted as "/v2/<tenant>/volumes?limit=1&marker=<marker>". In this
case the "next" link needs to be scoped to "/v2/<tenant>/volumes/detail".

The user could work around this issue my manually inserting '/details'
into the "next" link URL.

Test code is included to verify that the '/details' URL is correctly added
when the "next" link is included in a detailed pagination query. Also,
existing tests were changed to ensure that the correct controller function
(ie, 'index' vs. 'detail) are invoked for the appropriate query
(ie, non-detailed or detailed) -- 'index' was previously alwayed invoked
for detailed URL requests.

Change-Id: Ib00d6deb25255fac1db0f7bf4ecd3c8d30e1c39d
Closes-bug: 1299247

subject: Fix libssl/crypto symlinks on Fedora
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-09 18:13:10.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql/install.d/20-galera-libssl-symlink'], 'message': "Fix libssl/crypto symlinks on Fedora

Fedora does not have the 1.0.0 versions of the .so files, so the
existing symlink step isn't working correctly.  This change looks
for any 1.0.* versions of libssl and libcrypto, so we shouldn't have
to update it for every minor version bump but it also won't
unintentionally pull in an incompatible version.

Change-Id: I8402d05be684337df70d8f48e6d2ac1ecc69eaf7
Related-Bug: #1304629
"}]
commit_message:
Fix libssl/crypto symlinks on Fedora

Fedora does not have the 1.0.0 versions of the .so files, so the
existing symlink step isn't working correctly.  This change looks
for any 1.0.* versions of libssl and libcrypto, so we shouldn't have
to update it for every minor version bump but it also won't
unintentionally pull in an incompatible version.

Change-Id: I8402d05be684337df70d8f48e6d2ac1ecc69eaf7
Related-Bug: #1304629

commit_message:
Make libvirt volume pool configurable

Currently volume pool defaults to 'default'. This patch allows
specifying a custom pool so that storage limitations can be overcome.

Change-Id: I85762dc91f9f6ea479edb777fdb7a5618fbb9b9e

commit_message:
Introduce a path for accessing the current user

This will help with a lot of client side interaction because it means
the client will not need to know the user_id of the currently
authenticated user.

Change-Id: If457f5e264c5d1aef8ede7844cef36751a98ae73

subject: Add an automated naming convention for UNIQUEs
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-14 15:07:12.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/db/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Add an automated naming convention for UNIQUEs

For operating with UniqueConstraint names are needed, however these
names are in most cases generated by database in use, when the
constraint is created without name.

Omitting names when creating unique constraints leads to two problems:
1. UC name will be different for each database backend
(so we can't e.g. easily drop it in a migration script).
2. _raise_duplicate_error() depends on the specific format of UCs names
to return column names correctly.

Until we move to using SQLAlchemy 0.9, the implementation for
`remove_naming_conventions` can not be designed.

Change-Id: I5558ae6e7e1db2a50875641f551eef7360708e01
"}]
commit_message:
Add an automated naming convention for UNIQUEs

For operating with UniqueConstraint names are needed, however these
names are in most cases generated by database in use, when the
constraint is created without name.

Omitting names when creating unique constraints leads to two problems:
1. UC name will be different for each database backend
(so we can't e.g. easily drop it in a migration script).
2. _raise_duplicate_error() depends on the specific format of UCs names
to return column names correctly.

Until we move to using SQLAlchemy 0.9, the implementation for
`remove_naming_conventions` can not be designed.

Change-Id: I5558ae6e7e1db2a50875641f551eef7360708e01

subject: keystone::wsgi::apache install dependancy python-paste-deploy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-02 06:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'keystone::wsgi::apache install dependancy python-paste-deploy

On Redhat/CentOS, python-paste-deploy is not installed as a dependancy of
other packages.

The WSGI scripts fails outlining it can not import paste deploy

This ensures that it is installed by default

Params for both Redhat and Ubuntu packages are listed for completeness
and less conditionals

Change-Id: Iadc9cc9cb926a57cb75d9002a6a81f589201fc63
Implements: package install
'}]
commit_message:
keystone::wsgi::apache install dependancy python-paste-deploy

On Redhat/CentOS, python-paste-deploy is not installed as a dependancy of
other packages.

The WSGI scripts fails outlining it can not import paste deploy

This ensures that it is installed by default

Params for both Redhat and Ubuntu packages are listed for completeness
and less conditionals

Change-Id: Iadc9cc9cb926a57cb75d9002a6a81f589201fc63
Implements: package install

subject: Make stack.sh failing if SELinux is enforcing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-01 15:53:19.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Make stack.sh failing if SELinux is enforcing

On Fedora 20, starting rabbitmq-server.service fills
/var/log/audit/audit.log and then fails because the SELinux policy of
RabbitMQ doesn't allow to listen on an ephemeral port.

Until the bug is fixed in Fedora, I propose to make the stack.sh failing
to warn the user of the bug with a message explaining the bug and how to

Example of audit logs:

type=SYSCALL msg=audit(1396364497.544:136306): arch=c000003e syscall=49

commit_message:
Make stack.sh failing if SELinux is enforcing

On Fedora 20, starting rabbitmq-server.service fills
/var/log/audit/audit.log and then fails because the SELinux policy of
RabbitMQ doesn't allow to listen on an ephemeral port.

Until the bug is fixed in Fedora, I propose to make the stack.sh failing
to warn the user of the bug with a message explaining the bug and how to
workaround it. In my opinion, it's more convinient than adding a note
somewhere in DevStack website or DevStack documentation.

Example of audit logs:

type=SYSCALL msg=audit(1396364497.544:136306): arch=c000003e syscall=49
success=no exit=-13 a0=10 a1=7f2badca1980 a2=1c a3=1 items=0 ppid=1
pid=32383 auid=4294967295 uid=998 gid=997 euid=998 suid=998 fsuid=998
egid=997 sgid=997 fsgid=997 ses=4294967295 tty=(none) comm="beam.smp"
exe="/usr/lib64/erlang/erts-5.10.4/bin/beam.smp"
subj=system_u:system_r:rabbitmq_beam_t:s0 key=(null)

type=AVC msg=audit(1396364497.544:136307): avc:  denied  { name_bind }
for  pid=32383 comm="beam.smp" src=30839
scontext=system_u:system_r:rabbitmq_beam_t:s0
tcontext=system_u:object_r:unreserved_port_t:s0 tclass=tcp_socket

Change-Id: If718d74e559c6050cbc7786dc6da74c4847b6328

subject: Provide a keystone.conf for tempest
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-03-26 23:51:57.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Provide a keystone.conf for tempest

The keystone.conf file isn't readable by the tempest user so it
can't run commands like `keystone-manage db_version`. This is for
security reasons.

This change adds a keystone.tempest.conf file that tempest has
access to. It only has the database connection string (so it
doesn't include the admin token or ldap password).

Closes-Bug: #1284341
Change-Id: I4ce406f32189a81c6a7361a11dc474886629b806
"}]
commit_message:
Provide a keystone.conf for tempest

The keystone.conf file isn't readable by the tempest user so it
can't run commands like `keystone-manage db_version`. This is for
security reasons.

This change adds a keystone.tempest.conf file that tempest has
access to. It only has the database connection string (so it
doesn't include the admin token or ldap password).

Closes-Bug: #1284341
Change-Id: I4ce406f32189a81c6a7361a11dc474886629b806

commit_message:
Default project quota flavor

This blueprint is to define a default quota flavor for a specific
project.

The main use for this is to set up a quota flavor used to configure by
default the project user quotas when the user is created.

Related to blueprint default-quota-flavor.

Change-Id: I2529a97abcccc5fe07c9158c1f96c2c1883bf863

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-21 12:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/heat', 'lib/keystone'], 'message': 'heat configure auth_token for v3 keystone

Because heat now creates users in a non-default domain, we need
to ensure auth_token uses the v3 keystone API, otherwise tokens
owned by the stack-domain-users created by heat will be denied
access to the heat API.

For folks still using the v2 API there is a HEAT_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
variable, which can be set to "2.0" to return to v2 settings.

Change-Id: I70cde0ffb437a949b6a1e8caa54c4db458df1e48
Related-Bug: #1291097
'}]
commit_message:
heat configure auth_token for v3 keystone

Because heat now creates users in a non-default domain, we need
to ensure auth_token uses the v3 keystone API, otherwise tokens
owned by the stack-domain-users created by heat will be denied
access to the heat API.

For folks still using the v2 API there is a HEAT_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
variable, which can be set to "2.0" to return to v2 settings.

Change-Id: I70cde0ffb437a949b6a1e8caa54c4db458df1e48
Related-Bug: #1291097

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow outputs to be specified as hidden

This makes it possible for a user to mark an output as hidden, so that
the value of the output is obfuscated when the stack is shown.

The idea is to later add functionality that will allow a user to pass
a parameter that shows hidden parameters. For example, users could
mark password values as hidden, and then only show them when they
specify with the parameter

Co-Authored-By: Richard Lee <rblee88@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint add-hidden-attribute-to-outputs
Change-Id: I370a25165c91b119c6600283cddd32ee5e930b3f

commit_message:
Implements: Security group record in Server Details included Name & description as a optinal arguments.
            Now if you want to create security-group, there is no need to add name & description as complulsory parameters.
            Just run nova secgroup-create, it will create group with id/UUID for nova-network & neutron.
Closes-Bug: #1254722

Change-Id: If9fa245ba11e0a6df727dfd10810fb97ee3124d9

commit_message:
Import distributed port groups into neutron DB

This change is to add a method into vcenter neutron agent
to sync distributed port groups into openstack, and map
them to network objects in neutron for vm deployments usage.

Change-Id: Ica50e69956f0c311b53b82bd52b7929047e8255a
Implements: blueprint vcenter-neutron-agent

commit_message:
Support passing 'neutron_insecure' to neutronclient

When using a self-signed certificate for the network service endpoint,
the metadata agent has to pass the 'insecure' flag to neutronclient.
Otherwise requests will fail due to the failed certificate validity
check.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1269740
Change-Id: I091b1620ab60184921cc12e038af5d717d4d476f

commit_message:
Poll the agent child processes status (WIP)

discovers the situation where a child process has died via
a health check, method and uses the process status implementation
to propagate the status to the parent of the agent.

partially implements blueprint agent-child-processes-status

commit_message:
Provide agent status via status file (WIP)

Exposes agent status to a file which can be queried by the parent,
this mechanism could be used to expose status conditions, like
lost broker connectivity, dying childs, or anomalous status.

implements blueprint agent-service-status

Change-Id: I0bcc9ba14a46a81b5f34ffbf43494da00188f5d5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-02 15:16:57.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Filter deployment status when building metadata

A deployment, no matter its status is 'IN_PROGRESS' or 'COMPLETE' is now
included into the metadata for a server.  This is incorrect.  When a
second deployment is applied to the same server, the pre-existing
deployments may be applied again.

This patch fixes the problem above by filtering out all deployments
whose status is not 'IN_PROGRESS'.  In other words, 'COMPLETE' or
'FAILED' deployment won't be deployed again after this patch is applied.

Change-Id: I9e1ffd9c06a011feaf960cf5ebb0eb0f7b28f637
Closes-Bug: #1300626
"}]
commit_message:
Filter deployment status when building metadata

A deployment, no matter its status is 'IN_PROGRESS' or 'COMPLETE' is now
included into the metadata for a server.  This is incorrect.  When a
second deployment is applied to the same server, the pre-existing
deployments may be applied again.

This patch fixes the problem above by filtering out all deployments
whose status is not 'IN_PROGRESS'.  In other words, 'COMPLETE' or
'FAILED' deployment won't be deployed again after this patch is applied.

Change-Id: I9e1ffd9c06a011feaf960cf5ebb0eb0f7b28f637
Closes-Bug: #1300626

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-02 17:25:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'delete_on_termination strict parameter checking

Since this is such an important flag, strict checking of
configuration flags should be turned on (otherwise, what should
the behaviour of "3" be? etc). This also results in the
default behavior being False to prevent None values.

Change-Id: I65b6665d3c006845699f547cbd07e0564b5c46c3
'}]
commit_message:
delete_on_termination strict parameter checking

Since this is such an important flag, strict checking of
configuration flags should be turned on (otherwise, what should
the behaviour of "3" be? etc). This also results in the
default behavior being False to prevent None values.

Change-Id: I65b6665d3c006845699f547cbd07e0564b5c46c3

commit_message:
Provide instructions for sample config without tox

In some cases, such as when building a package, you don't want to use
tox to generate a sample config.  Provide instructions for how to
generate the sample config using the local env and not a tox managed
virtual env.

Change-Id: Ie2291ffd7a541f0324ea8db611c70048df5372ab

commit_message:
List all forbidden attributes in the request body.

When request content is validated by applying
cls.check_immutable_params() and an exception is
raised all forbidden parameters should be listed
in one response.

Change-Id: I15b3fa979bdb33bd341b0b99c1802af46273f358

commit_message:
Read deleted instances during lifecycle events

This prevents us from failing to find the associated instance if
the lifecycle event happens after the instance has been deleted,
as in the case of a ... delete.

Change-Id: I819ddf8ff68edc407d7932bf43771c440f514f26
Closes-bug: #1304968

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2807, 'name': 'Bryan D. Payne', 'email': 'bdpayne@acm.org', 'username': 'bdpayne'}, {'_account_id': 7063, 'name': 'Robert Clark', 'email': 'hyakuhei@gmail.com', 'username': 'hyakuhei'}, {'_account_id': 9098, 'name': 'Nathan Kinder', 'email': 'nkinder@redhat.com', 'username': 'nkinder'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-10 00:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['notes/OSSN-0012'], 'message': "Add OSSN-0012 - OpenSSL Heartbleed vulnerability

This adds OSSN-0012, which covers the OpenSSL Heartbleed
vulnerability.  This isn't a vulnerability in OpenStack itself, but
OpenStack deployments are likely affected since they would be using
OpenSSL for SSL/TLS.

Change-Id: I2db43e23dc0b090887e937be6188b64e2a0a2ad5
"}]
commit_message:
Add OSSN-0012 - OpenSSL Heartbleed vulnerability

This adds OSSN-0012, which covers the OpenSSL Heartbleed
vulnerability.  This isn't a vulnerability in OpenStack itself, but
OpenStack deployments are likely affected since they would be using
OpenSSL for SSL/TLS.

Change-Id: I2db43e23dc0b090887e937be6188b64e2a0a2ad5

First step is to create an image in glance. Next step will be to
upload the image data. That's how it is done in glance.

The created image will be marked as "queued" until the data is
sent.

Fixes bug 1301441

Change-Id: I5871367b6869e3bd048061635ec562d080345eb8
'}]
commit_message:
Use glance as a backend for Solum LanguagePack API (POST Method)

First step is to create an image in glance. Next step will be to
upload the image data. That's how it is done in glance.

The created image will be marked as "queued" until the data is
sent.

Fixes bug 1301441

Change-Id: I5871367b6869e3bd048061635ec562d080345eb8

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-23 20:26:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/api/metadata/handler.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py'], 'message': 'Include proper Content-Type in the HTTP Headers

Nova Metadata Service was not setting the Content-Type
in the HTTP Response headers. Because of this, clients
were receiving the default Content-Type which is "text/html".
The changes done in this patch will include proper Content-Type
in the HTTP response headers.

Closes-Bug: #1243878
Change-Id: Ia65cdf8099c85f63d7f44f93835c606d679a7ab3
'}]
commit_message:
Include proper Content-Type in the HTTP Headers

Nova Metadata Service was not setting the Content-Type
in the HTTP Response headers. Because of this, clients
were receiving the default Content-Type which is "text/html".
The changes done in this patch will include proper Content-Type
in the HTTP response headers.

Closes-Bug: #1243878
Change-Id: Ia65cdf8099c85f63d7f44f93835c606d679a7ab3

commit_message:
Add db2-server and db2-client recipe

There are no changes in current files and attributes,

commit_message:
Renamed default handlers to noop

They're not the defaults, and all they do is log.
It makes more sense to call them noop anyway.

Fixed a bug in conductor/handlers/test_default uncovered
when deployer.default was removed.

Changed the configured default for worker to 'shell'
instead of 'noop'.

Change-Id: I761374ed840b1766e79816d0e0803347a3016ea2

commit_message:
let users can config max_url_length

The token_id will be contained in some url, such as
v2.0/tokens/{token_id}. If the token is too long, the users will
get 414 requset_too_long response. So, we let users can config
the max length of the url.

Change-Id: I214a72e32ed7b55043604fda4252d8e2cf1ddd9f

commit_message:
The V2 Api should delete a non existent image

Glance V2 api initiates the deletion of an image that
got deleted during upload. This ensures that there
are no orphaned chunks of the image left behind

Fixes bug #1226013

Change-Id: I4cf5c49d2a6d2157a38467d9f7bcb20c4562b642

        glance/api/v2/images.py
        glance/common/utils.py
        glance/domain/__init__.py
        glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py

Change-Id: Ib7855c1d928ab8262dd2a109619a4e3d2299ff9e

commit_message:
Prevent min_disk and min_ram from being negative

At the moment, in both api versions, min_disk and min_ram can be set to
negative value - which doesn't make sense. This commit fixes this behavior
in the two versions of the glance api.

Conflicts:

        glance/api/v2/images.py
        glance/common/utils.py
        glance/domain/__init__.py
        glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py

Change-Id: Ib7855c1d928ab8262dd2a109619a4e3d2299ff9e
Closes-bug: #1265711
(cherry picked from commit a5b78ae0b502ad0ee95037f5b1d9619dba3dab81)

Right now if the ComputeFilter encounters a disabled host,
it just logs it at debug level and skips it. If the host was

commit_message:
Make automatic disabled host scheduler fail use warn instead of debug

Right now if the ComputeFilter encounters a disabled host,
it just logs it at debug level and skips it. If the host was
automatically disabled because of a connection fail,
we should at least log that as a warning in the scheduler.

Change-Id: I2ad6dbcf48b3c73a339dd1b92ebd58b4a7b0bfa2
Partial-Bug: #1258625

New _mapped_to_this_conductor() method with fix added to

commit_message:
Fix hosts mapping for conductor's periodic tasks

If node has a driver which does not supported by some conductors
_sync_power_states and _check_deploy_timeouts periodical tasks
will be broken for this conductors (KeyError raised in mapping
check).
New _mapped_to_this_conductor() method with fix added to
ConductorManager.

Change-Id: I4bceabab0b931e970ea7136a66ea8762ce99a52b

subject: Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-09 22:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/volume.py', 'heat/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount
(or attach the same volume to different mount on the same server,
or attaching the same volume to different server).

This patch makes all properties of VolumeAttachment
to be update_allowed, adds necessary handle_update logic
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume
so that new one can be immediately attached.

Change-Id: Id81a53a34b5bb2dfbc9425b91be0d02539fe2456
Closes-Bug: #1269686
Closes-Bug: #1251439
'}]
commit_message:
Add handle_update to VolumeAttachment

Updates for volume attachments were handled in UpdateReplace manner,
which fails when in need to attach new volume to the same mount
(or attach the same volume to different mount on the same server,
or attaching the same volume to different server).

This patch makes all properties of VolumeAttachment
to be update_allowed, adds necessary handle_update logic
and fixes VolumeDetachTask to reliably detach old volume
so that new one can be immediately attached.

Change-Id: Id81a53a34b5bb2dfbc9425b91be0d02539fe2456
Closes-Bug: #1269686
Closes-Bug: #1251439

subject: Ensure outputs are resolved for adopted stacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-09 22:12:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_parser.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/functions.py'], 'message': 'Ensure outputs are resolved for adopted stacks

The resolution of outputs is only performed for stacks in certain
states, so we need to add ADOPT to the valid list of actions,
as after a stack is ADOPT COMPLETE, it should be possible to resolve
the outputs in the same way as after create.

Change-Id: I52d710e5fb23b21848133b9845b2eba3ce76c4cb
Closes-Bug: #1299173
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure outputs are resolved for adopted stacks

The resolution of outputs is only performed for stacks in certain
states, so we need to add ADOPT to the valid list of actions,
as after a stack is ADOPT COMPLETE, it should be possible to resolve
the outputs in the same way as after create.

Change-Id: I52d710e5fb23b21848133b9845b2eba3ce76c4cb
Closes-Bug: #1299173

subject: VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-27 20:30:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': 'VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes

When there is more than one compute node running and one of the
nodes restarts it terminates on an exception that the resource is
not found.

The cause of the issue is that a vif plug was being attempted for
a resource that did not exist. The vif plug should have raised an
"NotImplemented" exception.

Change-Id: I5a3f1cc73a981173b6c2fa493de3aad10a7e97fd
Closes-bug: #1272286
(cherry picked from commit d46f4a5b6d17f20a9c1de9367af11c9f3e7a7ef0)
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix exception when using multiple compute nodes

When there is more than one compute node running and one of the
nodes restarts it terminates on an exception that the resource is
not found.

The cause of the issue is that a vif plug was being attempted for
a resource that did not exist. The vif plug should have raised an
"NotImplemented" exception.

Change-Id: I5a3f1cc73a981173b6c2fa493de3aad10a7e97fd
Closes-bug: #1272286
(cherry picked from commit d46f4a5b6d17f20a9c1de9367af11c9f3e7a7ef0)

subject: plug_vif raise NotImplementedError instead of pass
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 20:20:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/stubs.py', 'nova/virt/docker/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/docker/test_driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/virt/powervm/test_powervm.py', 'nova/virt/powervm/driver.py'], 'message': 'plug_vif raise NotImplementedError instead of pass

The Hyper-V, VMware, Docker and PowerVM drivers raise
NotImplementedError from the plug_vifs and unplug_vifs
methods rather than pass.
The compute manager handles the NotImplementedError
case when initializing the host.

Fixed bug 1218593

(cherry picked from commit 6ef9262a6aa39b2da8023067386b832a35ecc45c)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
Change-Id: Id17a1f691f46816eadfe257d9ac0cc46502318ef
'}]
commit_message:
plug_vif raise NotImplementedError instead of pass

The Hyper-V, VMware, Docker and PowerVM drivers raise
NotImplementedError from the plug_vifs and unplug_vifs
methods rather than pass.
The compute manager handles the NotImplementedError
case when initializing the host.

Fixed bug 1218593

(cherry picked from commit 6ef9262a6aa39b2da8023067386b832a35ecc45c)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
Change-Id: Id17a1f691f46816eadfe257d9ac0cc46502318ef

subject: Devstack support for Neutron VPNaaS
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-03 14:26:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': 'Devstack support for Neutron VPNaaS

Includes two enhancements to support VPNaaS and allow other
vendor implementation support. Goal is to provide a solution
for VPN .ini files until a more general solution can be defined
to handle all reference and vendor .ini files.

First, the /opt/stack/neutron/etc/vpn_agent.ini file is copied
to /etc/neutron, to allow the selected device drivers for agent
to be specified. Both reference and vendor implementations can
be uncommented in this file, prior to stacking.

Second, to allow vendor VPN implementations to provide an .ini
file to the agent at start-up time, an environment variable is
defined and can be set in the localrc to specify one or more
.ini files. The desire is NOT to include vendor settings in the
global vpn_agent.ini.

Change-Id: I5370ee57bbe326eff505a53055da4fddc0838de4
Closes-Bug: 1301552
'}]
commit_message:
Devstack support for Neutron VPNaaS

Includes two enhancements to support VPNaaS and allow other
vendor implementation support. Goal is to provide a solution
for VPN .ini files until a more general solution can be defined
to handle all reference and vendor .ini files.

First, the /opt/stack/neutron/etc/vpn_agent.ini file is copied
to /etc/neutron, to allow the selected device drivers for agent
to be specified. Both reference and vendor implementations can
be uncommented in this file, prior to stacking.

Second, to allow vendor VPN implementations to provide an .ini
file to the agent at start-up time, an environment variable is
defined and can be set in the localrc to specify one or more
.ini files. The desire is NOT to include vendor settings in the
global vpn_agent.ini.

Change-Id: I5370ee57bbe326eff505a53055da4fddc0838de4
Closes-Bug: 1301552

commit_message:
Fix seamicro power.validate() method definition

* Add task param to the power.validate method definition
* Also add unit tests for the power.validate method

This was not caught when unit testing Ironic using python-seamicroclient
because there is no unit test cover for this method.

Change-Id: I9ed175cffa29b8c10a32c7e121525142e4b170a5
Closes-Bug: #1303670

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 19:39:31.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/trust/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Adding more descriptive error message

Keystone Trusts API sends non descriptive error message for requests with
invalid trust id.
The error message only contains invalid_trust_id  instead of printing:
"Could not find trust: invalid_trust_id"
Setting kwarg "trust_id" in the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1305272
Change-Id: I35cab35ab90cf66ce7124dea142013bec9eefda9
'}]
commit_message:
Adding more descriptive error message

Keystone Trusts API sends non descriptive error message for requests with
invalid trust id.
The error message only contains invalid_trust_id  instead of printing:
"Could not find trust: invalid_trust_id"
Setting kwarg "trust_id" in the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1305272
Change-Id: I35cab35ab90cf66ce7124dea142013bec9eefda9

commit_message:
Hash functions support different hash algorithms

The token hash functions always used MD5. With this change, the
hash function can be passed in to the hash functions.

SecurityImpact
Related-Bug: #1174499

Change-Id: Ia08c2d6252bb034087a244b47d5bcbea7dcfa70b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-09 16:54:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py'], 'message': 'Add RBAC policy for ec2 API security groups calls

The revoke_security_group_ingress, revoke_security_group_ingress, and
delete_security_group calls in the ec2 API were not restricted by policy
checks.  This prevented a deployer from restricting their usage via
roles or other checks.  Checks have been added for these calls.

Closes-Bug: #1290537
Change-Id: I4bf681bedd68ed2216b429d34db735823e0a6189
(cherry picked from commit d4056f8723cc6cefb28ff6e5a7c0df5ea77f82ef)
'}]
commit_message:
Add RBAC policy for ec2 API security groups calls

The revoke_security_group_ingress, revoke_security_group_ingress, and
delete_security_group calls in the ec2 API were not restricted by policy
checks.  This prevented a deployer from restricting their usage via
roles or other checks.  Checks have been added for these calls.

Closes-Bug: #1290537
Change-Id: I4bf681bedd68ed2216b429d34db735823e0a6189
(cherry picked from commit d4056f8723cc6cefb28ff6e5a7c0df5ea77f82ef)

commit_message:
Fix bug detach volume fails with "KeyError" in EC2

Modified volume['instance_uuid'] to volume.get('instance_uuid'),
to avoid "KeyError", when detach a volume with "attaching" status.

Change-Id: Ic1aacab212c2a2026d18ef57ad9d77fdc6d86b47
Closes-Bug: #1280532

commit_message:
Fix ordering of arguments to tgt-admin --delete

A while back we added the force flag to the
tgt-admin --delete for cases where the tgt was busy.
It seems that *some* versions of tgt-admin actually
care about the ordering of the arguments here.

Addition of the --force flag was to address

Related-Bug: #1159948
Closes-Bug: #1304719

Change-Id: Idd9acb694c89fd13ff1ae39a2a345e4a876b774b
